loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  était gestionnaire d’une station d’essence, mais ne gagnant pas assez de revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa femmes et de ses 02 enfants, il a abandonnée cette activité et a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait des services de photocopie et la vente de divers articles de bureau, sa photocopieuse est en panne, il voudrait en acheter un autre, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une photocopieuse.
texts.en:
This gentleman used to be the manager of a gas station. But, not earning enough income to provide for his wife and two children, he abandoned that business and opened his own shop, in which he offers photocopying services and sells various office items. His photocopier broke down, and he would like to buy another one. This is why he's requesting a loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Pioneras” esta representado por L. señora Sandra Iris y conformada por 12 miembros que en sus mayoría se dedican a L. venta D. barrotes en tiendas D. barrio, venta D. comida, videos, material D. limpieza y batidos otros se dedican a L. pintura D. casas y otras a L. confección D. prendas D. vestir. L. competencia no les preocupa mucho ya que cada una es dueña D. sus casetas y saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y su dedicación a sus negocios. El financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. más mercadería para hacer crecer sus ingresos y materiales e insumos que ayuden a incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar así L. calidad D. vida D. sus familias. En cuanto a L. experiencia D. créditos solidarios muchas D. las socias ya contaban con elL. gracias a anteriores financiamientos con otras instituciones por lo que conocen L. responsabilidad y L. unidad que se requiere para adquirir L. confianza y el apoyo D. L. Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group “Las Pioneras” (the Pioneers) is led by Sra. Sandra Iris and is comprised of 12 members. The majority of the group is involved in retail businesses that sell groceries, food, videos, cleaning supplies, and milkshakes. Other members are engaged in house painting and tailoring. They are not worried about the competition and each member maintains a vending location. They know how to get ahead because of their experience and dedication to their businesses.

This group loan will be used acquire merchandise, materials, and supplies that will help the members increase their earnings so that they can improve the quality of life for their families. Many of the members have previous experience working in solidarity groups and with other financial institutions, so they are aware that responsibility and cooperation is required in order to gain the confidence and support of Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel R. es uno D. los socios del banco comunal Cristo Salvador. Él tiene 35 años D. edad, soltero, su domicilio esta ubicado en Horacio zevallos, distrito D.  Ate,  departamento D.  Lima. actualmente asume el cargo D. presidente D. la  alcancía comunal “Cristo Salvador” la cual esta integrada por 11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: comercio y servicios.
Miguel Trabajó 11 años  como obrero en la empresa  “CONCISA” un service D. sedapal. A raíz que se retira D. la empresa, deciD. con sus ahorros invertir en un negocio en casa para ayudar a sus padres.
Logrando  así la apertura D. una bodega con el nombre D.  “MIKE”, abastece a sus clientes desD. hace 7 años con productos D. primera necesidad, venta  D. gas y otros, logrando  con ello hasta el momento   mejorar  su vivienda y cuidar D. sus padres.
Su reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería como: arroz, azúcar leche y  otros, para  seguir fidelizando y abasteciendo a sus clientes.
En el futuro anhela poder hacer  crecer su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket  y también le gustaría  tener una botica.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel R. is one of the members of the "Cristo Salvador" Village Bank. He is 35 and single. His house is located in Horacio Zevallos, Ate district, Lima department. He worked for 11 years as a laborer for the “CONCISA” business, which is a service of Sedapal (and independent water and drain service). Because he retired from the business, he decided to use his savings to invest in a business in his house to help his parents. That is how he was able to open a store named “Mike:” He has been supplying his customers with basic needs products, gas and other items, for seven years. Because of this, he has been able, until now, to improve his home and take care of his parents. He has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for six years. He currently is president of the Cristo Salvador Community Bank, which is maD. up of 11 members. They work at diverse activities like traD. and services. His recent loan will be used to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and others. This is to supply his customers and build their loyalty. In the future he wants to be able to make his business grow and convert it into a mini market. He would also like to have a pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk and others to supply his customers and build their loyalty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquire inventory of corn

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia M. is a 41-year-old entrepreneur living in Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Jose, 45, works for a construction firm. They have three children; the eldest is in high school and the two others are in grade school.

Pacencia owns and manages a general store, which she started two years ago. She is now earning at least 2,800 PHP a month despite stiff competition amongst neighboring stores. She uses her profits to help provide daily basic needs of the family, especially her children’s education.  

She came to know and became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008.  She is now on her third loan cycle. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP to be able to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

Just like everybody else, it’s been her desire to graduate from poverty and she sees education as the best tool to equip her children. That is why she works hard to support their schooling.
   
About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is 20-year-old engaged woman living with her parents. She has owned a baby clothing shop since 2007 at her town. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional clothes to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Las socias D. AMISTAD son todas del mismo barrio, cada una D. ellas tienen sus propios negocios con el que día a día trabajan, como ser venta D. comida, costurera, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. refrescos empanadas,  promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. sabanas, venta D. edredones, venta D. ropa. En cuanto a la competencia  en sus negocios indican que existe pero pese a eso ellas saben sacar  adelante sus respectivos negocios. El crédito lo utilizan para hacer crecer sus negocios tener más capital, tener a futuro un negocio consolidado. Los antecedentes crediticios D. este Banco Comunal AMISTAD van por el tercer ciclo es muy bueno todas se llevan bien, son bien activas. Algunas D. las socias trabajan solo con Agrocapital y otras trabajan extra con otras entidades financieras. Amistad es un grupo organizado, ellas en cada reunión llevan a cabo una rifa para hacer crecer su caja chica y así al finalizar el ciclo puedan tener más ahorros. Para sus reuniones preparan refrigerios y D. vez en cuando comparten alguna festividad como ser el día D. la madre o día D. la amistad, es un grupo muy organizado.
texts.en:
The members of the AMISTAD (friendship) group are all from the same neighborhood, and each one of the women has her own business where she works daily, for instance, selling different kinds of food, sewing, running a grocery store, promoting cosmetics, or selling bedding supplies and clothing. There is competition for these businesses but these women know how to keep moving forward. They plan to use the loan to grow their businesses with more capital so they can make them stronger in the future. This the third loan cycle for the AMISTAD Community Bank, and the previous ones have gone very well. Some of the members work only with AgroCapital, while others work with other partner microfinance institutions. AMISTAD is an organized group. At each meeting the members conduct a raffle to increase their petty cash fund and can finish their loan cycle with more savings. For their meetings they prepare snacks and once in a while get together on holidays, like on Mother's Day or Friendship Day. It is a very organized group.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells various brands of detergent at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old and married with two children. Her older child studies at the College of Education while the younger one is in secondary school. Patience's husband is a commercial driver. She lives in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more detergent to sell. In the future, she hopes to purchase a van that she will use to distribute her detergent. She hopes to be the sole distributor of detergent in her community. 
Patience is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase detergent to sell

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en:
Jorinda H. is from the village of Bagumbang Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 28 years old. Jorinda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jorinda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and vegetables in the local community. Jorinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jorinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jorinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah J. is currently in the business of selling various items such as rice, books, salt, soap, etc. in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil and sugar to sell.  Florah is 24 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock jerrycans of cooking oil and sugar to sell

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel U. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His wife looks after her 2-year-old son at home and helps in her husband's business whenever she can. She is now eight months pregnant and is expecting her second child soon.  Odgerel has a small business with his mother-in-law. He rents a 1.5-meter-wide stall at the local black market and sells various women and men's clothes imported from China. His mother-in-law works as a saleswoman at the stall and handles all the sales of clothes while Odgerel travels to China to import the clothes. He has been doing this clothes retail business with his mother-in-law since 2005 and he says that his mother-in-law is a good business partner. Odgerel and his mother-in-law dream of having their own store where could sell their clothes in a more convenient way. 
He requests a loan to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora  María C. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad este banco está integrado por un grupo de socias que tienen sus deseos y fuerza de salir adelante demostrando a sus hijos el valor del trabajo y la forma de ir superándose cada día, este banco se localiza en la  parroquia Cumbe siendo este lugar privilegiado para la producción ganadera y agrícola.

María vive en el barrio 3 de Noviembre en la parroquia Cumbe, es una socia alegre y carismática del bankito por lo que se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras, tiene 41 años de edad y se encuentra casada, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 23, 21, 19, 15, 12 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja en una fabrica llamada Indurama y  no ayuda ecónomamente  en los  gastos de la casa, su segunda hija trabaja en una ferretería y su sueldo es para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo ayuda en la casa por lo que aun no encuentra trabajo y sus otros dos aun son estudiantes;  su esposo trabaja como chofer de un camión, siendo su mayor orgullo poder contar con su casa propia.

María se dedica a la crianza de animales desde muy pequeña, tiene vacas, gallinas cuyes, la leche de sus vacas entrega a los carros lecheros, sus gallinas y cuyes los vende  a sus vecinos de la comunidad o cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Se encuentra 11 años trabajando  los prestamos en la fundación  y llego a ser socia porque escucho un anuncio realizado por perifoneo en su comunidad, los préstamos obtenidos los ha utilizado en la educación de sus hijos ahora con el nuevo credito va a comprar gallinas, cuyes y su alimento como es hierva,  balanceado y  maíz.

Su meta es construir un galpón para criar más gallinas incrementar su criadero.
texts.en:
María C. is a member of the Nueva Amistad communal bank. This bank is made up of a group of members who have their dreams and the strength to get ahead, showing their children the value of work and the way of improving themselves every day. This bank is in the Cumbe parish, a place that is privileged with its livestock and farming produce. María lives in the 3 de Noviembre suburb in the Cumbe parish. She is a happy and charismatic member of the bank and she gets on well all her fellow members. She is 41 and married. In her married union she has had 5 children who are 23, 21, 19, 15, and 12. Her first child works in a factory called Indurama and he does not financially help in the living expenses. Her second child works in a hardware store and her salary is for her personal expenses. Her third child helps in the home because he still has not found work and her other two are still students. Her husband works as a truck driver and it is their greatest pride to be able to have their own home. María has raised animals since she was very young. She has cows, chickens and guinea pigs. Her cows' milk is taken by the milk trucks and she sells her chickens and guinea pigs to her neighbours in the community or when she has some financial need. She has been making use of the foundation's loans for 11 years and became a member because she heard an announcement over a loadspeaker in her community. She has used the loans for the education of her children and now with the new loan she is going to buy chickens, guinea pigs and their feed such as grass, nutritional feed and maize. Her aim is to build a shed to raise more hens to expand her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, grass, nutritional feed and maize

loans.name: Lilian Ayuma

texts.en: Lilian is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She has been running a chemist for one year. She employs one person.  Through FAULU Kenya, she has gained record keeping and planning skills. She has requested for a loan of KES 25,000 to use towards buying chemist drugs. She hopes to have a prosperous and stable family life in the future. Lilian also dreams of operating a wholesale chemist in the future. She describes herself as trustworthy, hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Add stock of drugs for chemist shop.

loans.name: Washington Eduardo

texts.es:
Washington C. de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 2 hijas.  

Washington hace 3 años empezó con una computadora haciendo trabajos para oficinas, poco a poco ahorro dinero y pudo comprar dos impresoras para tener más clientes.

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00, haciendo trabajos de computadoras, impresiones a color / blanco-negro y escáner. Una de las dificultades es el espacio físico de su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, bloques para ya tener un lugar fijo de trabajo. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de Cibercafé.
texts.en:
Washington C. is 42 years old and lives in an urban zone of Suburbio de Guayaquil. He has a cement house with the basic services of water and light. His wife is a house wife and with her he has 2 daughters. 3 years ago Washington began with 1 computer doing work for offices, little by little saving money until he could buy 2 printers to have more clients. Now he works every day from 7am until 8pm, doing computer work, printing in black and white and colour, and scanning. One of the difficulties he finds is the physical space his business needs. With the loan Washington wants to buy cement, stones and blocks to have a stable working space. In the future he wants to have a branch of Cibercafé.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, stones and blocks

loans.name: Jabiel Antonio

texts.es: Jabiel de 32 años de edad, es soltero, habita en la Comarca Villa Alvarez junto a su mamá, a quien le ayuda con las actividades de trabajo del campo, ademas se dedica al cuido de su su pequeña parcela que le heredo su mamá para que iniciara su propio patrimonio,  en la que tiene establecimiento de cultivo, ordeño y cuido de su pequeño inventario ganadero,  brindandoles buen manejo sanitario y nutricional, esta solicitando su 3er crédito para compra de tenero para engordarlos y desarrollarlo para posteriormente comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias, con las que brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su núcleo familiar, su mayor sueño es salir adelante, consolidar su inventario ya que es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos cuando los tenga.
texts.en:
Jabiel is 32 years old, single, and lives in the Villa Alvarez District with his mother, who helps with the work around the farm. In addition, he looks after a small parcel of land that his mother inherited and will help him start accumulating his own assets. This property will be set aside for raising, nursing, and caring for a small herd of cattle and will help facilitate good sanitation and nutritional management. Jabiel is requesting his third loan to buy calves to fatten and raise for later resale. His objective is for his animals to achieve a good weight so that he can obtain higher earnings and provide better living conditions for his family. He hopes to get ahead and strengthen his herd so that he can leave it as an inheritance for when he has children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Karla Jesennia

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene la edad  de 35 años, vive en el barrio  Memorial Sandino, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace varios años, un trabajo cansado pero tiene que trabajar para apoyar  a su familia dos hermosas hijas  las cuales cursan sus estudios, como padre de familia es mucha responsabilidad, es por eso ambos trabajamos para lograr el equilibrio de los gastos. A si como lograr hacer las mejoras para su pequeña casa, que es cerrada de madera el piso aun de tierra. Con este financiamiento lograra cambiar el zinc que esta en mal estado, como hacer el arranque de piedra. Y poco a poco ir haciendo bonita y segura su casa. Sus planes es poder cambiar de trabajo para lograr mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Karla is thirty-five and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband is a taxi driver, and for a number of years she has been working in domestic service. It's a very tiring job, but she has to work to support her family, including two beautiful daughters who are still in school. Being a parent carries a lot of responsibility, so they both work to be able to keep up with expenses, as well as make improvements to their small house, which is made of wood and even has a dirt floor. The loan will allow them to replace the zinc that's in ill repair and to put in stone. Little by little they're making the house pretty and secure. Their plan is to be able to change jobs to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Ayinla

texts.en:
Ayinla is married, has four children and is 43 years old. His children attend school and this gives him joy as a father. He is a hard working and honest man and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

He sells VCDs (video compact discs) at retail prices to his customers. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his immediate family. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. He has been in this business for nine years. He is requesting a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Ngeno

texts.en:
Ngeno is 37 years old and married with four children between the ages of 16 and 27 years old. Four of the children are still attending school. Ngeno is a hardworking farmer from the North Rift Valley of Kenya near Litein town. He has been in this business for fifteen years and has two employees. Ngeno sells his milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns some income from a posho mill (which grinds grain into flour) and a butchery he operates in the same area. 

He has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. Ngeno's main challenges are transporting the milk to the market and the constant fluctuations in the prices of milk. He says that this loan will enable him get a good dairy cow that will produce more milk and enable him to earn more income. This income will enable him educate his children and repay the loan. In the future he hopes to acquire a large piece of land, and expand his dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 47 year-old woman with four children, ages 27, 23, 20, and 17. She lives in Cusco with her spouse and two youngest children; the others have now left their childhood house and live on their own. Esther is a member of the community bank María Auxiliadora, which is comprised of eleven members all hailing from the Cusco region. 

Esther makes a living running a tienda de abarrotes, or grocery store, in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Here she sells staples such as eggs, rice, and pasta. She will use the loan as business capital for her store, buying items that she needs to sustain the enterprise. Esther is thankful for and appreciative of the loan, and promises to pay her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Restocking her grocery store

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en: Zahir A. is 37 years old. He is a farmer who has been breeding sheep for the last three years. He sells them to the local butchers. Zahir is married and has two children. He lives and works in Imishli city where the main livestock bazaar is located so he does not need to go a long way to sell his sheep. He usually sells sheep to the local butchers and to the restaurants, as mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people. Zahir is going to develop his business. He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase 14 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil Q. is a 33-year-old businessman who sells different kinds of goods, including men's clothes and underwear, electronics and home products, such as dishes. He is married and has three children. 

Adil recently started his business, but his store already brings him a stable monthly income of 500-600 AZN. Adil's shop is the sort of shop where you can get anything you need for home — that’s why he always has a lot of customers. The goods he sells are in very high demand among the local people. 

Adil applied for a 700 AZN loan to increase and diversify the number of products he sells. His dream is to build another shop like this in another part of the city.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Benita Lastenia

texts.es:
Benita de 57 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un puesto de venta de pollos y gallinas afuera de su casa. 

Comenzó la venta de pollos por la falta de oportunidades y porque necesitaban mas ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos, poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposo ella ha podido mantener su negocio. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder tener mas ventas ella quiere incrementar el numero de pollos para vender por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar pollos y gallinas. En el futuro quiere un local porque ahora solo es un puesto de madera con sombrilla.
texts.en:
Benita is 57 years old and lives in the urban zone, El Guasmo, Guayaquil ( a place inhabited by informal retailers). She has a stand where she sells chickens and hens outside of her house. She began selling chickens due to a lack of opportunities and a need for a larger income in order to care for their three children. Little by little and with help from her husband she has been able to maintain her business. Now, she works from 7:00AM to 1:00PM everyday. In order to have more sales, she wants to increase the number of chickens to sale that is why with this loan she would like to buy chickens and hens. In the future she would like to have a permanent establishment because right now all she has is a wooden stand with an umbrella.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer de 53 años de edad, comerciante de una pequeña pulpería que ha venido invirtiendo con dinero propio de su salario como maestra.
Pues ha logrado mantener estable su negocio, solo que abecés no tiene el capital para seguir invirtiendo.
Es por eso nace la iniciativa de adquirir un financiamiento que logre las expectativa de aumentar en inventario, logrando a si ventas altas.
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, que es el alimento principal, lácteos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros. 
Sus planes es jubilarse, y dedicarse tiempo completo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a 53-year-old woman. She is the businesswoman of a small grocery store in which she invested with the money that she earned herself as a teacher.

She has been able to keep her business stable, but at times she does not have the money to continue investing.

This is how the initiative came about to obtain funding to achieve the hope of expanding her inventory and thus having high sales.

With this loan she will invest in basic grains, which is part of the main diet, dairy products, meat, sweets, and sodas among other things.

Her plan is to retire and dedicate herself full-time to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, sodas and other items to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Sakomah Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to further boost their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy more goods, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Memuna K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Yele village and is forty-six years of age. She is married to a retired soldier and they have two children who are attending secondary school.

For twenty-eight years now, Memuna has been running a restaurant, selling cooked food and drinks. With her share of this loan, she will be able to buy drinks, rice, and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.use: To buy drinks, rice, and other cooking ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a 48 married man with three children, all in the upper level of schooling. He sells picture frames to clients who are mostly studio owners in the Kirinyaga area.

He joined KADET after being introduced by another client. He has now applied for his first loan which he will use to expand his business and make more picture frames. He would like to see his business expand to other towns with other studios.

loans.use: To expand his picture frame business

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mrs. Von S. works sewing clothes in a factory and has been engaged in her job since 2009. She has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a military policeman in the ministry of interior. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their one kid, who attends the public local school. 

Von S. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Von S. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN D. AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana;   ella tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda;  La socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. adobes, ella tiene un terreno en el cual contrata peones para elaborar los adobes y luego venderlos, ella trabaja al por mayor. La socia también tiene en su casa un pequeño hospedaje familiar, ella alquila cuartos a turistas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra D. materiales como son arcilla y paja al por mayor para la elaboración D. adobes.               

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Señor Pan D. Azúcar" communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Sebastiana.  She is a 61 year-old widow.  She makes and sells adobe bricks.  She has a piece of land where she hires workers to make the adobe bricks, and then to sell them.  She works in wholesale.  She also has a small family hostel where she rents rooms to tourists.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale materials, like clay and straw, for making adobe bricks.

Ms. Sebastiana is grateful for and values the loan being offered to her.  She also promises to comply with her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale materials, like clay and straw, for making adobe bricks

loans.name: Mila

texts.es: Mila tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Tiene su tienda desde hace 6 años, en un inicio vendía útiles de escritorio, con el tiempo implementó su negocio con productos alimenticios que hasta el día de hoy vende con mayor intensidad. Desde entonces atiende todos los días incluidos los fines de semana; con el tiempo la demanda de productos ha aumentado, asimismo sus clientes le piden comida para animales, ya sea de aves o reses. En tanto, se dedica también a la agricultura, en donde siembra papa y maíz principalmente; esto es un punto a su favor para mejorar su economía. En adelante Mila desea seguir vendiendo  productos de acuerdo a la necesidad de sus clientes. Es su séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, por ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para incrementar su negocio con variados productos, asimismo continuará con la siembra de maíz, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en: Mila, 31, lives with her husband and their 2 children in her parents' house.  She has had her store for 6 years.  She initially sold stationary, and later began selling foodstuffs, which now sell more frequently.  Since selling food, she works in the store every day including weekends.  With time, demand for products has increased, with her customers asking for animal feed, be it for birds or cattle.  In addition, she works as a farmer, principally growing potato and corn, another way she tries to improve her income.  Going forward, Mila wants to continue selling products as her customers need.  This is her seventh loan from MFP.  She is very happy in knowing she has financial support, because of being a responsible person in paying back, and she also likes being part of her community bank because all the members support one another.  She thanks those who will be donors for the loan she is asking for, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business.  She will use the loan she is asking for to increase her business with various products, as well as continue planting corn, for which she will buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Supply her store with various products.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and married with two children. For the past year and a half, she has been selling kangas (cloth commonly worn by Swahili women), powdered soap, and face creams door-to-door. She works from 9 am until 4 pm and earns a daily profit of approximately US$ 10. 

This will be Fatuma's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Her dream is to one day build a house and to live a good life.  

Fatuma is a member of the 'Nyerere Group'. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Fatuma can be seen in the photo in the second row, first from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business selling kangas, powdered soap, and face creams

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over ten years, she has been selling lesos (kikois) from door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. Ann faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation incurred when moving from door to door selling kikois. She hopes to start selling clothes and shoes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of lesos (kikois) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos (kikois) for resale

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Activos de Santa Fe 1, 2 & 3 (Active from Santa Fe) and Santa Fe is their community´s name. Ana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to settle in a foreign country and to fight with change. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to eat.

Ana is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 10 years, starting by selling clothes and shoes. She operates a colmado, a convenience store, in her neighborhood. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, flour and other foods. She will use the profits to invest in her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen de 38 años, hace un año atrás se separo de su esposo y ella tuvo que comenzar a conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años de edad. Inicio con las  ventas productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes por catalogo). 

Por la buena administración que le ha dado a su capital de trabajo ahora es conocida por el sector donde vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Hace por semana pedidos para que les lleguen los productos que les piden sus clientes y los vende a un bajo costo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am visitando a sus conocidos y clientes fieles para que compren los productos. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando surtiendo su mercadería comprando con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, tratamientos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ofrecer sus productos y surtir su mercadería vendiendo ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old.  One year ago she separated from her husband and had to start making money so that she could support her three children aged 12, 8 and 2.  She started selling Yanbal products.  Yanbal is a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to start making independent catalog sales.

Thanks to her good management of her working capital, Carmen is now known in her district of El Fortín de Guayaquil, a district which is noted for its dirt roads and mountains.

Every week Carmen takes orders and then delivers the products that her customers have requested.  She sells her products at low prices.  She works from 8.00am visiting her acquaintances and loyal customers so that they can buy her products.

Carmen would like to continue working, stocking her business with merchandise.  She would like to use her loan to buy perfume, creams and treatments.  In the future, she would like to have premises from which she could sell her products, stock her business with merchandise and sell clothes too.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams and treatments

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique owns a business that sells soft drinks. She is 40 years old, married and has five children who are between four months and eighteen years old. Her husband is a driver. 

Dominique has been selling soft drinks for sixteen years.  Her loan will be used to buy more milk, bread, mineral water, and juice to sell. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy living room furniture. She dreams to have a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, mineral water, and juice to sell

loans.name: Rutilio

texts.es: Rutilio M. de 61 años de edad, reside en San Lorenzo, en el departamento de San Vicente, él vive solo en casa propia, y desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la venta ambulante de pantalones para hombres y mujeres. Rutilio vende las prendas de vestir en varios sectores de San Vicente, esforzándose día con día para vender todo su producto. Es de esta manera como él se gana la vida y puede contar con todo lo necesario para salir adelante. Rutilio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más comprando diferentes tallas y estilos de moda para ampliar su mercado de consumo y de esta forma contar con mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan tener una mejor economía.
texts.en: Rutilio M., age 61, lives in San Lorenzo, in the San Vincente department. He lives alone in his own home, and has sold men's and women's pants as a street vendor for 10 years. Rutilio sells the garments in various locations in San Vincente, working hard every day to sell all of his products. This is how he makes his living and is able to have everything necessary to succeed. Rutilio is requesting a loan with which to invest more in purchasing different sizes and styles to expand his merchandise. This way, he will have more income which will allow him to have a better economic situation.

loans.use: the purchase of pants to sell.

location.town: San Lorenzo, departamento de San Vicente

loans.name: Julia Adriana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Julia Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza encerrando un ambiente de paz, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señorita. Julia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es de profesión sastre y labora en su casa, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señorita Julia se dedica a estudiar en la universidad y se encuentra cursando el quinto ciclo de la carrera de Derecho, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal actividad que lleva realizando un año.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá y su tía, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos. Su meta es  terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Julia Z. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Paccha, which is characterized by beautiful nature surrounding an environment of peace. Its people raise animals and work in agriculture.

Julia is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father is a tailor and works in their home. Her mother does domestic work. They do not own their own home so they lease.

Julia is studying at university and is in her fifth cycle of law studies. In her free time she sells Yanbal products, which she has done for a year.
 
This is her second loan with the communal bank. She was invited by her mother and aunt. She will invest the loan in purchasing more cosmetics. Her goal is to finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Ma. Rolenda

texts.en:
Ma. Rolenda L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Ma. Rolenda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Rolenda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Ma. Rolenda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Rolenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Rolenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ma. Rolenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ma. Rolenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Tto purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
An ordered life is something Lourdes P., 49, yearns to have for her whole family.  She is doing all she can to achieve just that. One effort to reach this goal is to have a means of sustainability. Thus, Lourdes joined CCT* as a community partner, and, with the entrepreneurial learning she gains there, she is able to run her own small business. Lourdes is married to Rolando, who is a water tender. They have a child who is now in high school.

Lourdes directly sells beauty products, such as local brands M.S.E., Natasha, and Board Walk,  and other accessories to friends, neighbors, and business connections. She also sells silver jewelry chosen for her clients' tastes. Rolando, on the other hand, makes money by delivering gallons of water to the homes of fellow community members with the use of his side car. Their monthly family income reaches around Php10,000.

To help grow her business, Lourdes decided to ask for a Php14,000 loan. She intends to use this loan money to purchase her own stock of products, accessories, and jewelry items for sale. She needs enough money on hand to buy her customers' orders even before their initial payments. The loan money, Lourdes says, increases her capacity to earn and helps to augment the needs of her family.

One major problem she faces is the fact that some customers do not pay on time. Lourdes takes the responsibility of paying for the sold item. But Lourdes is willing and ready to face whatever challenge lies ahead, just for their lives to be sustained and be in order. She commits herself to financing the studies of her child until she sees this child graduate from college. She also desires to renovate their house, and all these efforts will depend largely on the growth of her business.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Restocking inventory

loans.name: Esi Awotwi Comfor

texts.en:
Esi Awotwi Comfor A. is a single mother with four children.  She is from Kokowada, near Elmina. For three years, she has made her living selling corn and cassava dough, which people purchase to make banku, a staple in the Ghanaian diet. 

As the sole breadwinner for her family, it is critical to Esi to bolster her earnings by expanding her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more corn and cassava to prepare more dough for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase corn and cassava to make dough for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is thirty years old and married. Her husband is a businessman and they have three children between the ages of thirteen and three. Her business is at the busy Gikomba market in Nairobi and is well known by the name Elsus Leather Shoes. She has been selling shoes to retailers and other local people for the last three years. Susan has been able to provide employment to three people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is debtors who refuse to pay as per the agreement. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy leather for making shoes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She wants to open another outlet and create employment opportunities. She also sees herself building a house for her family. She describes herself as social, aggressive and committed to her work.

loans.use: to buy leather for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his room

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita S., from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela, is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She has been selling food products in the local community for two years now, usually earning 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 25000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. Melita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Rhesa

texts.en:
Rhesa R. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Rhesa is widowed and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Rhesa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Rhesa has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rhesa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rhesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and married. She has two children, aged 2 and 3. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Grace tills her land, where she grows rice and corn crops. Grace does her best to improve her earnings and provide for the needs of her household.

Grace's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with four children. Rosemarie is 43 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Rosemarie owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase more products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste for her general store.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to use the additional income from the business to supplement her family's income and use for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo and soap for her general store

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
La Tienda de Jesús es el nombre que este emprendedor decidió darle a su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, ubicado en Medellín, a sus 60 años de edad la falta de oportunidades para conseguir trabajo hicieron que desde hace cuatro años, Jesús iniciara con su negocio. 

Actualmente Jesús necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos artículos que le permitirán ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes como harina, arroz, aceite, fríjoles, entre otros, así incrementará sus ventas y mejorarán sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“La Tienda de Jesús” (Jesús’ Store) is the name this entrepreneur decided to give his business.  He sells basic household items and is located in Medellín.  

At the age of 60, employment opportunities were few which led Jesús to start this business four years ago.

At present, Jesús needs a loan to buy some items like, rice, oil, and beans, among others, that will make it possible for him to offer greater variety to his customers thus increasing sales and improving profits.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, flour and beans, among others.

loans.name: Teresa América

texts.es:
En la ciudad turística de Catarina, reside doña  Teresa América, quien labora para la institución de Alcaldía Municipal desde hace catorce años, como Responsable de Finanzas, es casada con cinco hijos  menores, trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de doña  Teresa es ampliar su casa para la construcción de la habitación de sus hijos,  ya que tres están en edad adolecente y necesitan sus habitaciones para mayor privacidad es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder comprar materiales de construcción como piedras, cemento y arena y así brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa América lives in the tourist city of Catarina.  She has worked as the head of finances for the government of the municipality for 14 years.  She is married and has five minor children.  She works arduously to give them the necessities.  

One of the necessities that Teresa’s family is experiencing is expanding their house to build a room for their children.  Three of them are adolescents, and they need their rooms for greater privacy.

That is why she came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan from us.  The loan is to be able to buy construction materials like rocks, cement, and sand.  That way they will give their children greater security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing and roofing beams.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, 41 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lanh's husband earns money as a bricklayer. Lanh supports her family by sewing masks at her house. Lanh intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production of masks and also to make small repairs to her house.

Lanh hopes her business runs smoothly and that will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric, materials and repair her house

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, the leader of this 5-member group loan, was born in 1966 and lives in Khu 5 village, where she has two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter, and her family has a workshop where she and her husband work, earning a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). This will be her first loan from SEDA as she seeks to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood.

The other members of the group are:

Gai, a 49-year-old mother of two children, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy chicken feed;

Oanh, a 33-year-old mother of three, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood;

Dan, a 42-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry;

Dinh, a 33-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Nayla Johanna

texts.es:
Nayla de 32 años camina mucho ofreciendo su mercadería, ella recorre todos los dias de 7:00 am a 20:00,  vende ropa de damas, caballeros y niños con la dificultad que amenaza a su barrio que es la delincuencia y la competencia aunque piensa que para todos hay mercado.Su esposo Edicto es albañil pero cuando la demanda está baja se dedica a hacer fletes en su camioneta, tienen 2 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela, los que dice son su orgullo.
Ellos quieren comprar cemento, hierro y fierro para terminar de construir su casa que es mixta, motivo por el requieren un préstamo para seguir con su negocio y hacerles un dormitorio a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nayla, 32, walks a lot to sell her merchandise.  She wanders daily from 7am until 8pm.  She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes despite her neighborhood’s high crime rate and competition, although she believes that there’s market enough for everyone.  Her husband’s a bricklayer but when demand is low he does delivery services with his truck.  They have two children going to school and she says that they are her pride.

They want to buy cement, iron rods and metal to finish building their house, which is mixed, which is the reason why they need a loan to stay in business and to build bedrooms for each of their children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron rods and metal.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella siembra maíz y luego vende las verduras como tomates, cebollas, zapallos entre otras verduras y también vende maíz en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como zapallos, tomates, zanahorias y comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Purificacion, 54, is a member of the VIRGEN NATIVIDAD community bank in Urubamba, a district in the "departamento" of Cusco.  

Sra. Purificacion is married and has 7 children.  She spends part of her workday tending her farm and the rest working as a street vendor, operating a vegetable-sales business.  She sells tomatoes, onions, pumpkins and other vegetables, along with maize.  She grows maize on her farm, as well.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm.  The businesses have been her means of supporting her children.  Sra. Purificacion is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy pumpkins, tomatoes and carrots for her vegetable-sales business and the rest to buy seeds for her farming business.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business and seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 38 años, una mujer fuerte y valerosa, que en compañía de su esposo Erasmo, cuidan de sus hijos: Johan y Kevin. Ellos son una familia unida y con aspiraciones, que viven en la zona rural de Casacoto. Ella menciona que la mejor herencia que dejará a sus hijos, es el estudio; por eso está trabajando muy duro para pagar la universidad de sus dos retoños adolescentes. A pesar de su edad. Juana afirma que son muy responsables y que la ayudan en el cuidado de sus cultivos. Ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a ello y como buena agricultora, la mayor parte del día la pasa en sus sembríos de papa y hortalizas; los que en cada cosecha, según cuenta, le brindan buenas utilidades, pues viaja al mercado central de la capital, donde comercializa sus productos al por mayor; sin embargo en tiempos de escasa producción, los vendedores minoristas de su ciudad comprar sus cultivos a menor precio, eso la molesta mucho. Pero no la desanima, al contrario le da fortaleza para seguir adelante, ya que vende carne de ovino los días miércoles y domingo en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores de casacoto” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de los integrantes de su banco comunal, augurando muchos éxitos, ya que son buenos y honestos. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juana tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina”, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y el pago del salario a los peones que le ayudan en la cosecha.
texts.en:
38-year-old Juana is a strong and brave woman who, together with her husband Erasmo, cares for her children Johan and Kevin.  They are a united family with aspirations who live in the rural area of Casacoto.

Juana mentions that the best inheritance she will leave her children is an education.  For this reason, she is working very hard so that she can pay for her two growing teenagers' university education.  In spite of their age, Juana tells us that they are very responsible and help her in caring for her crops.  Juana has been in this business for 16 years and, as she is a good farmer, she spends most of her day amongst her potato and vegetable crops.  She tells us that every harvest time they provide her with good profits as she travels to the central market in the capital where she sells them wholesale.  However, during periods of lower production, the retailers in her town buy her crops at a lower price.  This bothers her a lot.  However, she does not lose heart.  On the contrary, it gives her the strength to get ahead.  On Wednesdays and Sundays she sells meat from sheep in the wholesale market in town.  This makes her additional money.

Juana belongs to the 'Miraflores de Casacoto' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the support of the other members of her community bank.  She predicts a lot of success as the bank members are good and honest people.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments punctually.  Juana has sown 'andina' variety potatoes and, with your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers and in paying the salary of the laborers who will help her with her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire laborers

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENCEDORAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Fabiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos artesanales, macramé, tejido a máquina, tejido de mantas, artesanías en aguayos

La señora Fabiana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejidos que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en diferentes ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la discreción del personal.
texts.en:
The Las Vencedoras ["the winners"] borrowing group will be taking out its third loan with Pro Mujer Bolivia [Kiva field partner] as a part of the Panamericana regional office. The group is composed of nine women and is led by an executive council, of which Fabiana is the president. The businesses run by the members are various and include artisanal weaving, macramé, loom weaving, blanket weaving, crafts, and colorful aguayo fabrics. 

Fabiana says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a year and became involved with the institution through the invitation of a promoter. Currently, she has an artisanal fabric business that she has been operating for years. This loan will be used to buy wool, which she will purchase at the Ceja market and then weave and sell in various markets and festivals in the city of El Alto. This line of work allows her to build up resources to support her family, as she is a single woman. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she appreciates the personal independence.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora verónica tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de cinco años.

Ella tiene seis años de dedicarse a elaborar pan de forma artesanal, fue su mamá quien le enseño este oficio, ya que su mamá quedo viuda y creció a sus tres hermanos sola, por lo que les enseño a defenderse y a ganarse la vida. Ellas hacían tamales y pupusas antes de que falleciera su padre.

Para comprar los materiales que necesita para realizar su trabajo como maíz, harina, queso, entre otros, ella debe trasladarse hasta la ciudad, para esto ella aborda un bus que tarda unas cinco horas de ida y vuelta a su casa, esto lo hace una vez por semana.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar suficientes materiales para tener a disposición por los pedidos que le hacen en la comunidad, tiene mucha demanda ya que su pan es elaborado de forma artesanal y no es común como las quesadillas, tortas y pastelitos. Ella elabora el pan y lo sale a vender tres veces a la semana de casa en casa a pie a las comunidades.

Con el préstamo espera obtener más ganancias y de esta forma podrá ayudar a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar como alimentación, salud, educación y comprar medicamentos para su hijo, ya que padece de una enfermedad y tiene un tratamiento costoso y los ingresos actualmente no son suficientes.

Ella quiere ahorrar con los ingresos que genere el aumento de la producción de pan para ayudar a su compañero de vida a comprar un lote y construir su casa, ya que ellos viven en casa de un familiar del esposo, además  quiere que su hijo asista a la escuela el próximo año.
texts.en: Verónica is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their 5-year-old son. For the past six years she has made a living baking artisan bread. Her mother taught her this trade. She was a widow and had to raise Verónica and her three siblings on her own, so she taught her children how to fend for themselves and get ahead in life. They made tamales and pupusas before her father died. To buy the materials she needs to make her products, such as corn, flour, cheese and other items, Verónica has to travel to the city once a week, boarding a bus that takes five hours round trip from her house. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Campo to purchase the ingredients she needs to fulfill the orders she has in her community. Her demand is really high since her handmade products, such as quesadillas, tortas and cupcakes, are uncommon. She bakes the bread and goes out to sell it door to door through the community three times a week. With the loan, she hopes to earn more profits and in this way she can help her husband with household expenses like food, health and education, and pay for medicine for her son, who is sick and has costly treatments, and right now their income isn't enough to cover it. Verónica wants to save what she makes from increasing her production to help her husband buy a lot and build a home, since they live in the house of one of her spouse's relatives. Furthermore, she wants her son to attend school next year.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make larger quantities of bread.

loans.name: Adija

texts.en: Adija is a determined businesswoman.  Twenty-eight years old, she is single and blessed with two children. She has been selling skins and hides for the last five years to make a living. Previously, she sold handbags. Adija has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to become the distributor of the skins and hides in her region. With the loan she has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy hides and skin for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy hides and skin.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Las Señoras del comité Las tejedoras, son personas muy trabajadoras,  ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades pueden invertir en sus negocios y otras las nuevas miembros iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la Sra. Norma, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de cosas, como ser, ropa, artículos de mercería y otros. Comenta que hace poco paso por una de las peores experiencias, pues falleció su bebe recién nacido, pero ella de igual manera sigue siendo muy activa en el grupo e incluso ayuda a otros grupos de la zona. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, pantalones y demás para tener más variedad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are members of the sewing group and are very hard-working.  They are very grateful for the foundation's assistance in growing their businesses and commercial activities.
The group's director, Norma, lives with her husband and children and sells varied articles such as clothing, accessories and other items. Sadly, she recently lost a newborn baby, but despite this continues to be active with the group, working with other women in her area.  The women realize that by working together they can achieve greater productivity to meet their orders.  Norma seeks this credit to buy clothing such as shirts and pants, and to offer a greater variety of items to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and other clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle and this enabled him to overcome his challenge of having to remit his daily income to his boss. He now has hardships of high fuel costs and seasonal weather challenges.  He would like to buy land for construction and growing crops. John intends to use this loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Nailepu

texts.en:
Nailepu is a very hard working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is 37 years old and married, they have five children. 

She is applying for her second  loan. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cebollas, zanahorias y maíz y luego lo vende en el mercado de Calca desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de  agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANCASUN DE ARIN", which is located in the district of Calca, in Calca Province, in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Sabina is 27 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  In addition to her daily activities she also has a patch of land where she grows onions, carrots and corn which she sells at the market in Calca.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and is able to provide for her children through her work.  She wants to increase her agriculture business and has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 31, lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school, in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, a wool-felting enterprise which he started earlier this year that produces handmade felt products such as slippers and boots.

Because his felting machine is old and very slow, in order to meet customer demand he is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new felting machine.

loans.name: Sarybay

texts.ru: Сарыбаю 54 года, женат, воспитал пятерых детей. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Сарыбай начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. На 3,0 га орошаемой земли Сарыбай выращивает картофель, кукурузу и пшеницу, а также имеет в хозяйстве 3 головы коров и 5 баранов. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Сарыбая, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит от 5,000 до 25,000 сом (KGS)в сезон. Также, в несезонное время Сарыбай предоставляет услуги такси. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сарыбай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян пшеницы и картофеля, боронирование земли и покупку минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Сарыбай планирует вложить в постройку более удобного  и вместительного сарая и постройку забора.
texts.en: Sarybay is 54 years old, married and has raised five children.  In search of income sources for his family, he started his own animal husbandry and farming business in 2002.  He grows potatoes, corn and wheat on three hectares of arable land, and also has three heads of cattle and five sheep.  Thanks to Sarybay's tenacity and persistence, his business yields from 5,000 to 25,000 som (KGS) per season today.  He also provides a taxi service during the off-season.  In order to further expand his business, Sarybay requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase wheat and potato seeds, treat land and purchase mineral fertilizers.  He plans to invest the profit from this loan into building a more comfortable and spacious barn and building a fence.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a married woman and has two children. She is 43 years old and resides at Dalapang, Ozamis City, Philippines. She owns and operates a coco land (fertile ground planted in coconut trees). She plants & harvests coconut for sale to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,249 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Saybatou

texts.fr: Saybatou est cultivateur âgé de 72 ans il est marié et père de 15 enfants, il a commencé à exercer cette activité depuis qu'il est tout petit.Avec ce crédit,il va acheter du semence de tomate, d'onions, d'herbicide et d'engrais.
