She completed high school, but due to a lack of financial resources, she was unable to continue her studies. She got married at 26 and has 6 children, 3 of whom are still studying.

She sells food for a living, especially on Saturdays and Sundays, when she prepares special foods. On Mondays, she makes shambar, a traditional stew. She runs the business from her own home.

She plans to invest this loan of 300.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing pork and legumes.

Edelmira dreams of owning a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Magda Veronica

texts.es: La Sr. Magda tiene 31 años de edad, habitante del barrio tierra prometida, en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo trabaja como contratista de construcción el cual es trabajo agotador pero se gana bien, es una ayuda económica mas para la casa, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad, lo cuales estudian actualmente. Sus planes es crear un futuro mejor económico y social para sus hijos. Doña Magda se desempeña como vendedora de cosmético, zapatos, ropa y prendas, inicio su negocio con ingreso propios ya son ochos  años en el campo de venta lo cuales son de crecimiento y aumento de utilidad. Sus objetivos en corto plazo es la construcción de su casa, en un porche  lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para darle seguridad a su negocio y familia.  Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic  lograra tener una vivienda digna para su familia
texts.en:
Magda is 31 years old and lives in the Tierra Prometida ("Promised Land") neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is married, and her husband works as a contractor; the work is exhausting but pays well and is a good way to support the family. The couple has two children, who are 9 and 11 years old and are both currently in school. Their plan for the future is to create a better social and economic future for their children. Magda sells cosmetics, shoes, and clothing. She started the business with her own income, and now has eight years of experience. Over those years, she has expanded the business. Her short-term goal is to finish building her home by adding a porch. She will use her loan to buy construction materials like stones, sand, cement, and iron rods to keep her family and her business safe. Thanks to loans from Afrodenic, Magda will have a proper home for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Mr. Tom Nguon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group consists of twenty people who live in the village of Nor Neam Toteung village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Tom N. is the village bank loan group president selected by the members. He is a bed maker, which he makes from timbers. In his work, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy the timbers to make beds. Thus, he decided to request for a loan to buy timbers to make beds to sell. He hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Kong Ren, is a basket maker.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy timbers to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia N., 72, is married and living with her daughter to care for her seven grandchildren.

Sophia started trading foodstuffs 35 years ago; she is very serious about her business and believes hard work and dedication to be the antidotes to poverty. She also loves her work, saying she has selling in her blood and can't do anything else. 

Sophia trades in maize, beans, peanuts and more in the market of Abofour, the town where she lives. Sophia started this business with her mother while just a young lady, and has since inherited the business. At the time she began, she says, she did not realize the importance of an education as she does now. She continues to provide valuable resources for her family, and is doing all she can to support her grandchildren in their education.

Sophia is applying for a loan to buy a larger supply of inventory to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in Ghana. This would allow her to continue to help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih, a 22-year-old single man living in Aley in Mount Lebanon, works as a DJ and sells sound equipment and CDs. It is his first micro loan request from Ameen, and he is seeking to borrow $1,200 to buy sound equipment in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La señora Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, vive en la Av. Perú Nº 120, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada,  tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 100.00, por iniciativa propia, empezó su negocio vendiendo mercadería de ropas, con un pequeño bazar ubicada en su misma casa. 

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de Pollos a la brasa, y por las mañanas vende menú; en un local muy bien acondicionado, su casa.

Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 04  meses,  comprará  insumos como pollos vivos en javas, papas y tomates en sacos, mostazas, salsa de tomate y mayonesa en baldes para complementar el servicio de pollos a la braza; también bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas y aguas minerales en paquetes.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.

Vedith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vedith is a member of the "Sargento Lores" community bank. She lives at Avenue Perú Nº 120 in the Morales district of the San Martín department. Vedith is 44 years old and divorced. She has three children, two of whom depend on her economically. Vedith began with 100 soles, and on her own initiative she started a clothing sales business. She opened a small store in her own home. Now she sells braised chicken, and in the mornings she serves a full breakfast. Her restaurant is located in her home, which is well suited to cooking. With this loan of 2,500 soles, Vedith will buy supplies such as live chickens, sacs of potatoes and tomatoes, and buckets of mustard, ketchup, and mayonnaise. These will be used to complement the braised chicken meals that she serves. She'll also buy refreshing drinks, such as colas and mineral water. She'll repay the loan in four months. Vedith feels more independent and secure, now that she makes her own business decisions and earns her own income. Vedith would like to thank Manuela Ramos for helping her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies such as chickens, potatoes, tomatoes, condiments, and drinks

loans.name: Kudratkul

texts.ru:
Кудраткул 1964  года рождения, женат, имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Он  содержит дома несколько голов коров.   Во дворе  есть большой огород, где выращивает  помидоры и другие рассады. Со временем через 3 месяца, когда подрастут рассады, он продаст их. А остальные оставит  на получения урожая. За урожаем придут отдельные клиенты. И так он  сможет погашать свои проценты за счет продажи. 
А потом можно будет продавать уже подросших  быков или коров. 
В Микроинвест посоветовали обратиться соседи , которые уже получают кредит в течении 2 лет.
texts.en:
Kudratkul was born in 1964, he is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Kudratkul keeps several cows at home. In his yard he has a big garden where he grows tomatoes and other seedlings. With time, after 3 months, when the seedlings grow he will sell them. The rest he will keep for his harvest. Separate customers will come for the harvest. This way he will be able to make his loan payments from his sales. Later he will be able to sell the grown bulls or cows. Kudratkul was advised by his neighbors to turn to MicroInvest, they have been taking out loans for 2 years.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Esperanza es viuda tiene 50 años, dos hijos de 32 y 31 años que están casados.  
Desde joven siempre trabajo como vendedora, con la experiencia ganada puso su negocio de bazar.  
Esperanza necesita un crédito de 1400 soles, para la compara de cerveza, gaseosas, regalos para su bazar.
Desde que esta en Finca puede comprar más mercadería, con las charlas que ha recibido aprendió como llevar su  negocio, a ser mas ordenada, disciplinada
El sueño de Esperanza es comprarse una congeladora para su bodega.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of The Fortress Community Bank. She is a 50-year-old widow with two children, ages 32 and 31, who are both married. Since she was young she has worked as a saleswoman, and with the experience she gained she started a bazaar business. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 1,400 soles, which she plans to use to purchase beer, soft drinks and gifts for her store. Since joined Kiva partner Finca, she has been able to purchase more supplies and from the talks she has received she learned how to better carry her business and to be more organized and disciplined. Her dream is to buy a freezer for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks and gifts for her store

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de six femmes (4 polygames et 2 monogames)  qui ont en moyenne 27ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, mais principalement le poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché). En plus elles vendent  les produits cosmétiques, les parures,  les savons et  les chaussures. 
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont décidé  d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt de groupe, après avoir bien remboursés les trois prêts précédents.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 27 corbeilles correspondant à 405 kg de poisson frais. Une partie  est vendue fraîche en ambulant dans les quartiers de Kirango et l’autre moitié est d’abord  séchée avant la vente. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson frais uniquement sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec les pêcheurs du quartier. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Bousssin et Siribala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles comptent  réaliser chacune  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour l’épargne et pour la prise en charge des soins de santé  des enfants.
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver le plus longtemps possible  le  poisson frais.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed of six women (four polygamous and two monogamous) who average 27 years of age and 3 children. They all live in in the Djaka Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do commerce in various goods, principally fish in all forms (fresh, fried, smoked, and dried). In addition, they sell cosmetics, fine accessories, soaps, and shoes. In order to increase the volume of their income-earning businesses, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth group loan, after having repaid all three preceding ones. This new loan will be used to buy 27 baskets of fresh fish, equal to 405 kg. A portion is sold fresh door-to-door in the Kirango area, and the other portion is first dried and then sold. Supplies of fresh fish are gotten only on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango from area fishermen. The fish thus obtained is resold, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Bousssin, and Siribala, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each plan to realize an average monthly profit of 31,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to meet the healthcare needs of the children. Their ambition is to obtain a freezer in order to be able to preserve fresh fish for as long as possible.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy American rice, sugar, beans, flour, oil, chicken and beef

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is thirty years old and married with two sons who are in junior high school and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works for a sawmill firm in the area, while she is a trader. Grace trades in textiles such as printed fabrics, linings and other materials as well as school uniforms and other clothing. She sells in a shop located by the roadside in her community. Grace buys her goods from Accra and Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. Grace desires to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Bassirou O. G. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, mariée et père de 2 enfants. il est revendeur de cassettes à Lomé. Bassirou exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits et aussi assimiler le commerce des appareils électroniques.
texts.en:
Bassirou O. G. is a 35-year-old married father of two. He works as a cassette retailer in Lomé. Bassirou has been in this business for 3 years. With this loan, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing new products and also incorporating the sale of electronics.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase CDs, DVDs and electronics for resale

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es: Zenayda tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad de Huánuco (sierra central peruana), pero reside en la ciudad de Lima desde hace 10 años con su hija Anai de 9 años de edad, viven en su casa propia. Zenayda siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y luchadora, incursionó en varios oficios, los cuales requerían que se mantenga fuera de su hogar dejando sola su pequeña, es por eso que decidió optar por una labor que pueda realizar desde su casa para poder pasar tiempo con su niña. Entonces, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que le da los ingresos necesarios para que pueda solventar las necesidades de su hija, la cual es su razón de vivir. Cada día, luego de que su hija se va al colegio, Zenayda sale a ofrecer sus prendas a sus vecinas y amigos, los cuales siempre le tienen algún pedido debido a la buena calidad de la ropa que les ofrece. Actualmente está vendiendo polares (prendas hechas de una tela denominada polar, muy caliente) debido al frío de esta época del año. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda de ropa e ir progresando cada día más. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, en su banco comunal, denominado “Estrella Azul”, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque todos son muy amigos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Zenayda, 29, is from the city of Huánuco (central Peruvian mountain range). She has lived in the city of Lima for ten years. She lives with her nine year old daughter, Anai. They live in their own house. Zenayda has always been a hard worker and a fighter. She has done various jobs, which required her to be away from home and to leave her small daughter alone. That is why she decided to choose work that she could do from home, to be able to spend time with her daughter. She has been selling clothes for two years. This gives her the necessary income to be able to afford her daughter’s necessities. Her daughter is her reason for living. Each day, after her daughter goes to school, Zenayda leaves to sell clothes to her neighbors and friends. They always order from her because of the good quality of clothing that she sells. She is currently selling “polares” (clothes made from a material called polar, very warm) because it is very cold at this time of year. Her wish for the future is to have a clothing store and to keep progressing more each day. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She really likes working with her Community Bank, Estrella Azul, because all of them are good friends. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of clothes for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Kukapakia Group

texts.en: Belekai never went to school and is a widow with six children who are all high school graduates. She has an additional three orphans that she also takes care of. For the past ten years, she has been selling dry goods including rice and oil. The lack of sufficient funding is the main challenge, but she hopes to build a shop and to provide good education and medical care to the children as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao Mis.Occ. She is 49 years old. Dolores is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a business growing crops. She plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Dolores is just starting this business.

In 2001, Dolores joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolores has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to plant. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Dolores from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Idalia Maria's Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario Dios Nos Ama 2 esta formado por Idalia Maria A. A., Meyling Guadalupe A. R. y Florencio Román P. L., originarios de la Ciudad de Masaya. Inician su decimo ciclo de crédito y se sienten muy satisfechos con sus logros y su record crediticio que permanece intacto.

Idalia A. es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 28 años y trabaja en el negocio de mayor prestigio para la ciudad de Masaya; que es la venta de frutas y verduras, trabajo que realiza desde hace mas de 8 años y que inicio con solamente unas cuantas chiltomas (Chile Dulce) y cebollas. Actualmente posee un tramo en el mercado de Masaya con amplia variedad de frutas y verduras. Un tramo muy destacado por lo surtido de sus productos. 

Su meta es sacar a delante a sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 añosa quienes le dedica su vida y esfuerzo, es madre soltera y a pesar de que para ella la situación es muy difícil. Ha podido sobrellevar sus necesidades y las de su familia.

Meyling A. trabaja en la compra venta de productos cosméticos de diferentes líneas y Florencio trabaja en la venta de granos básicos en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The group "Solidario Dios Nos Ama 2" (In Solidarity, God Loves Us 2) is made up of Idalia Maria A. A., Meyling Guadalupe A. R. and Florencio Román P. L., who are from the city of Masaya. They are currently beginning their tenth loan cycle, and they feel very proud of their achievements and their credit record, which remains intact. Idalia A. is the group's coordinator. She is 28 years old and works in the most prestigious business in the city of Masaya: selling fruits and vegetables. She has carried out this work for more than 8 years, beginning with only a few chiltomas (sweet chiles) and onions. Currently, she has a stall in the Masaya market which offers a broad range of fruits and vegetables. In fact, her stall is well known for its wide variety of products. Her goal is to provide a better future for her two children, aged 10 and 7, to whom she dedicates her life and her efforts. She is a single mother, and in spite of her very difficult circumstances, she has been able to provide for her own needs and those of her family. Meyling A. works as a buyer and seller of cosmetic products from various manufacturers, and Florencio works selling bulk grains in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the business (various fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin, L. Suzanne vit depuis sept ans à Minontchou à Cotonou. Suzanne est mariée à DAOUDOU Christian, un imprimeur. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le mari de Suzanne. Suzanne vend à son domicile et à Dantokpa (marché international du Bénin), des bijoux et des colliers qu’elle achète à Dantokpa. Suzanne a déjà fait onze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Pour développer son activité et se ravitailler en bijoux, Suzanne sollicite l’aide de ALIDé pour l’obtention d’un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Suzanne L. has lived for seven years in the Minontchou area of Cotonou. Suzanne is married to Christian Daoudou, a printer. The couple does not have any children yet. The household expenses are taken care of by Suzanne's husband. Suzanne sells at home and at Dantokpa (the international market of Benin) jewelry and necklaces that she buys at Dantokpa. Suzanne has already gained eleven years of experience in this business. To develop her business and replenish her stock of jewelry, Suzanne is looking to obtain her first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn B. is from Pagadian City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Libbne Elizabeth

texts.es:
Libbne tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos para consumo desde el 2007. Adquiere lotes de 100 pollos de un día de nacidos a un distribuidor de la ciudad de Lima y los cría hasta que tengan 45 dias, luego los distribuye a los establecimientos de venta de carne de pollo del mercado de la ciudad y en algunas bodegas cercanas a su casa.

La demanda por sus pollos ha ido creciendo debido a que los cría con alimentos balanceados y en muy buenas condiciones. Libbne está pensando en comprar un nuevo lote de 150 pollos para ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alterntiva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como productora hasta tener una granja para terminar de construir su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Libbne, 49, is separated and lives with her two sons in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised and sold chickens for consumption since 2007. She buys lots of 100 one-day-old hatchlings from a distributor in the city of lima and she raises them until they are 45 days old. At that point, she distributes them among establishments that sell chicken meat in the city's market and in a few stores near her home. The demand for her chickens has grown because she feeds them nutritionally balanced feed in very good conditions. Libbne is thinking of buying a new lot of 150 chicks in order to enlarge her business but she lacks sufficient funds to do so. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a producer and having a large farm, finishing building her house, and continuing to support her children. She has worked with our institution previously and has shown herself to be a responsible client with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced chicken feed.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka K., 49, has been a leathersmith for 21 years.  He began as a shoeshine boy and now runs his own business.  His shop, Iganje Enterprises, is in Mombassa and his leading product is handsewn leather soccer balls.  He sells to schools, stores and individuals.  He also repairs shoes and makes leather covers for bibles.  Musyoka struggles with transport and does not have his own vehicle for marketing his product and delivering his goods.  He also deals with competition from large wholesalers.  He is using this loan to purchase leather, glue and inner tubes for soccer balls for which he has back orders.  He will also re-up his stock of leather soles for shoes.  His ultimate business goal is to have another branch of his shop and multiple employees; he currently has one.

Musyoka is married and has eight children.  He really hopes they will get a good education and become self reliant when they grow up.  He describes himself as talented with high energy and dedication.  He feels the lack of capital is the only thing holding him back from building a larger enterprise

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make soccer balls and to resole shoes.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 35 años, es padre de 5 hijos, los cuales están cursando estudios primarios y secundarios. Él vive junto a su esposa, quien lo apoyan en todo.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva yuca y frutos cítricos en las 4 hectáreas de tierra que posee. Pero mientras espera la época de cosecha, cría gallinas, a las que alimenta adecuadamente para que cuando las venda tengan un peso exacto y valgan un buen precio.
Para estas actividades cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa, quienes aprovechan los espacios de terreno de su chacra para sembrar algunos productos de pan llevar, para su  consumo diario. 
Lo que le gusta a Fredy de su trabajo es mantenerse activo y enseñar a los suyos lo que va aprendiendo de la agricultura. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque cuenta con un comprador  estable de sus yucas y cítricos; y respecto de sus gallinas, su ganancia es buena cuando las vende.  

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son personas confiables y sobre todo muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más plantas de yuca para seguir sembrando (con 200 soles), y con lo restante comprará abono para fortalecer su terreno para que sus productos crezcan fuertes y sanos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 35 years old and father to five children who are students in elementary and high school. He lives with his wife who supports him in everything. For five years, he has been dedicated to agriculture, cultivating yucca and citrus fruits in the four hectares of land that he owns. However, while he awaits harvest season, he raises hens which he feeds adequately so that when he sells them they are the right weight and are valued at a good price. For these activities, he counts on the support of his children and his wife who take advantage of spaces of land on his farm to sow some bread products for their daily consumption. What Fredy likes about his job is keeping active and teaching his family what he's learning about farming. At the same time, it is very profitable because he has a consistent buyer for his yucca and citrus produce and respect for his hens. His earnings are good when he sells them. This is his second loan with MFP and what he likes about his community bank is that all the people are trustworthy and, above all, very responsible with their payments. With the money he is requesting, he will buy more yucca plants to continue planting (with 200 soles) and with the rest, he will buy fertilizer to strengthen his land so that his crops grow strong and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yucca plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa L. is currently in the business of selling beans and peas in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and corn meal to sell. Santa is 25 years old and is married to a soldier. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and corn meal to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the village of Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing Internet services in the local community. Virginia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria M. de 59 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera con 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad.

Victoria empezó con una maquina de coser pequeña, cociendo las prendas que les entregaban sus vecinos, poco a poco tubo ingresos necesarios para poder comprar otra maquina mas grande.

Ahora Victoria trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano cociendo pantalones, camisas, vestidos etc. Una de las complicaciones que ella tiene para trabajar es aveces las enfermedades que le da.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser grande para tener a otra persona trabajando con ella. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados fijos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria M., 59, lives on the outskirts of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement, and she has all of the basic services. She is a single mother with three grown children. Victoria started with a small sewing machine; she made clothes that she delivered to her neighbors. Little by little she got enough income to be able to buy another, larger sewing machine. Now Victoria works everyday, and she starts very early. She makes pants, shirts, and dresses, etc. One of the complications that she has with her work is that she sometimes gets sick. She wants to use the loan to buy a large sewing machine in order to have another person working with her. In the future she wants to have fixed employees for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large sewing machine

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es:
Senaida, de 35 años, está casada con Salomón de 36 años; tienen 3 hijos: Miguel de 15, José de 13 y Sarvia de 10 años, todos viven juntos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años trabaja en la elaboración de cajones para el embalaje de frutas, por lo que semanalmente le pagan 90 soles. Paralelamente tiene cultivos de plátano y café que cuida con la ayuda de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo labora como conductor de un carro de transporte de pasajeros. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es vender los cajones que fabrica con sus propias manos y ver qué tan resistente son, para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas. 
Senaida considera que su trabajo es rentable porque con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar terrenos de cultivo donde sembró café, el cual cosechará en el mes próximo; asimismo logra cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y la educación de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan administrarla y obtener sus propios ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está satisfecha de trabajar en su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son unidos y solidarios. Con los mil soles que ahora solicita adquirirá decenas plantas de café y cien javas vacías para encajonar plátanos.
texts.en:
Senaida (35) is married to Salomón (36); they have three children - Miguel (15), José (13) and Sarvia (10) - and they all live together in their own home. For the last three years, Senaida has been working making boxes for storing fruit, for which she earns PEN 90 per week. Senaida also plants plantains and coffee with the help of her children, while her husband works as a bus driver. Senaida's favorite activity is selling the boxes she makes with her own hands and seeing how strong the boxes are, and how useful for people. Senaida believes her work is profitable because she has been able to use her earnings to buy fields in which she has planted coffee and which she will harvest next month. She is also able to cover the household expenses and her children's education. In the future, Senaida would like to have a grocery store at home that her children could manage and thus earn their own incomes. This is the second loan Senaida requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to work at her communal bank because its members show unity and solidarity with each other. With the loan of PEN 1,000, she will buy coffee plants and 100 empty boxes to store plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying coffee plants

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en: Leticia A. is from the village of San Pablo, Alicia, IsabeL.. She is 52 years old and is the group leader of a twenty-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Leticia is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used for a hog-raising business. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for a hog-raising business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia, ya no tiene hijos bajo su carga familia. 
Ella inicio el negocio de bodega hace algunos años, con algunos ahorros y luego lo ha 
ido incrementando con las utilidades obtenidas. Ella atiende el negocio de manera muy 
calida y amable ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientes son niños los cuales estudian 
en la escuela la cual queda a una cuadra de su negocio, el sueño a futuro de Maria es 
incrementar su negocio y así poder tener mayores ganancias, y todo esto le permitirá 
mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives alone in her own home as her children have moved out. She started her own shop a few years ago, with some savings and the business continued to grow with the profits the shop generated. Maria conducts her business in a very friendly way, as the majority of her customers are children who study at the nearby school. Maria's future dream is to increase her business and her income, as this will provide her with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy products like drinks, soaps, candles, batteries, cream and tooth paste

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro F. de 32 años de edad comenzó con este trabajo aproximadamente en el año 2.006. El vendió una motocicleta para poder tener un capital de trabajo, con el cual inició su propia micro empresa, compra y venta de ropas. 
En la actualidad ya tiene su clientela bien formada y estan emprendiendo un nuevo negocio(Carpinteria)y esta actividad ya forma parte de un su ingreso familiar.
El fabrica muebles de primera calidad para algunas mueblerias de la zona y otras para clientes particulares sobre pedido.
El invertiría este crédito en comprar de maderas para la fabricacion de sus muebles y el resto de crédito en la compra de más mercaderías(Ropas como: remeras, camisas, pantalones, chorps, blusas, championes y otros)
texts.en:
Pedro F. is 32 years old and started his business around the year 2006. He sold a motorcycle to be able to have capital to start his small business buying and selling clothes. Currently he has a well-established clientele and is launching a new carpentry business that will add to his family's income. He makes high-quality furniture for some furniture stores in the area and also for particular customers by request. He plans to use the loan to purchase wood to make the furniture and buy more merchandise (clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, blouses and other items) with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to make furniture

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Dany Duy, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2000 and have two sons. Both of the children are still young.  
Mrs. Saren C. has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. She taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, Mr. Dany Duy also raises goats at home. Saren is requesting a loan of $300 to repair the house where she lives. She will also use part of the loan to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
El señor Geronimo Gonzalez de 31 años de edad, esta casado la señora Antonia Dominguez de 30 años de edad, ellos aun no poseen hijos.
Don Geronimo comenzó con este negocio de la carpinteria aproximadamente en el año 2.006; como propietario, ya que la carpinteria le pertenecia a su padre,  con quien adquirió todos los conocimientos, durante varios años, en la actualidad el tiene personas que trabajan en su carpiteria fabricand muebles para exhibir en su local.
El invertiría este crédito en comprar más Madera; así como clavos, tornillos, cerraduras, etc. Y demás herramientas menores, teniendo en cuenta que su local se encuentra estrategiamente ubicado y tiene buen demanda. De esta forma mejoraría aun más la calidad de sus productos, de forma a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Geronimo is 31 years old and is married to 30 year old Antonia. They have no children. Geronimo started his carpentry business in 2006. The shop used to belong to his father, from whom he learned everything he knows over several years. He now has people who work for him in his shop, manufacturing furniture to display. He will use the money from this loan to buy lumber, nails, screws, hinges, small tools, etc. This will allow him to improve the quality of his products and increase his income. His shop is located in a strategic location and his services are in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

Paulina  N., age 37, is married with three children ages, 13,10 and 7 years.  She also cares for her 18 year old younger sister  who is studying in secondary school.  Paulina sells water to big trucks and home users and also has had a Gange Duka (swahili meaning selling sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, rice  and vegetable and fruits in the same shop) for two years now.  She works from 8am to 8pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $286.

This will be Paulina’s 3rd Motisha loan, the loan which is given to clients who are good payers, from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a water tank of 2000lts and to increase the stock of the Genge Duka. She has paid back the loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase  the water stock.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group Goodwoork, which totals 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture,  Paulin is 4th from right in the back row, wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: To increase water stock by pumping more water in the water tanks

loans.name: Heyran

texts.en: Heyran M. is a 57-year-old entrepreneur who has been involved in the poultry business for the last 12 years. She is married and has four children. Heyran sells chicken and geese to the local cafes and once a month at the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is about 150-200 AZN. Heyran also keeps cows for milk and dairy products for her family. She would like to expand her livestock business, so she applied for a 600 AZN loan to purchase one milking cow and more poultry.

loans.use: purchase one milking cow and more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of basic grains such as rice, wheat, soy, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es:
Gloria de 61 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella es costurera y confecciona ropa. 

Hace 15 años atrás ella cose ropa para poder mantener a sus hijos cuando eran pequeños, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener dinero para mantenerse estable económicamente porque no cuenta con otro ingreso ya que esta separada. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y utensilios para coser mejor, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su casa, y poder readecuar el espacio que tiene para taller de costura.
texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil (an urban zone where most of the residents are part of the informal economy). She is a seamstress and has been making clothing for 15 years. She began doing this so that she could support her children when they were very young. Little by little, and with lots of effort, she’s been able earn enough money to maintain herself economically; she does not have any other source of income because she is separated. She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. [Gloria] would like to use the money from this loan to buy clothing and utensils that will allow her to improve her sewing. In the future she wants to make some improvements to her house and make better use of her workshop space.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Señor Freddy  se dedica al transporte publico desde hace tres años y medio con movilidad propia, actualmente vive en alquiler, pero tiene un lote que se ha comprando,  el señor trabaja mucho  es muy responsable en su trabajo y en sus pagos el realiza su trabajo en la ciudad de Cochabamba, este crédito es para aumentar la construcción de su vivienda, el recibe la ayuda de su esposa que trabaja como trabajadora del hogar desde hace nueve años, tiene tres hijos. El señor actualmente no tiene deudas y lo mas desea es ver su casita terminada por eso necesita comprar materias de construcción como cemento, pintura, etc. El esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy has worked in public transportation for three and a half years with his own vehicle. He currently rents where he lives, but he has purchased a lot. He works a lot, and he is very responsible in his work and with his payments. He works in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is to do more construction on his house. His wife helps him; she has been a housewife for nine years. He has three children. He does not currently have any debts, and what he wants most of all is to see his little house completed. That is why he needs to buy construction materials like cement, and paint, etc. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Iram

texts.es: Iram, de 26 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo al que Iram se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender en la ciudad de La Merced, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que la ruta es muy accidentada y difícil de llegar. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, por que desea incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su grupo comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Iram is 26 years old. He is a very happy and hard working young man. He lives together with his parents and his greatest wish is to be successful in life. Iram's work is harvesting coffee and bananas. After the harvest he takes his products to sell in the city of La Merced, location where he receives the gets the best prices. He has been working at this business for the past 6 years. The most difficult part of his job is having to carry his products through a very treacherous path, making it very difficult to travel. In time he hopes to purchase more land so that he may increase the amount of harvest he acquires. This is his fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). With his past loans he has always been very punctual and he hopes to keep up his record. Within his community group is a very well liked member, his happiness is contagious to the other members. With the two thousand five hundred nuevos soles that he requests he will purchase more fertilizer to improve his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en: Lodgenia P.'s main source of income comes from providing sewing services like sewing school uniforms, pillow cases, shorts, etc., for her community. She is 52 years old, widowed and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lodgenia has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Lodgenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lodgenia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: La señora  Consuelo  V. V., de 47 años de edad  casada, tiene 3 hijos vive en Jocotenango tiene 12 años  de trabajar con dulces típicos, junta mente con su esposo y sus hijos que le ayudan hacer  cocadas, higos, camotes y muchas variedades. Anterior mente doña Consuelo trabajaba muy poco solo para surtir su local que tiene en el mercado de antigua , por no tener capital solo se mantenía con una mínima variedad, como muchas personas la buscaban le hacían pedidos  ella se decidió  hacer un préstamo en un Banco Comercial aunque le costo porque no estaba acostumbrada a tener deuda , pero viendo la necesidad de crecer en su negocio, solicito 5,000.00 quetzales y gracias a Dios obtuvo bonita ganancia  y así es como fue mas reconocida porque sus dulces son muy ricos y frescos , y hasta el momento ella trabaja proveéndoles  dulces a los hoteles mas reconocidos en Antigua Guatemala , ahora que ya tiene puertas abiertas necesita invertir mas para que su empresa crezca , y su sueño es comprar un lugar donde poder trabajar ya que por el momento trabaja en su casa y eso le a traído problemas ya que por mucho dulce que trabaja hay muchas abejitas y esto  les molesta a sus vecinos también quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles estudios que sean profesionales y puedan ir en la universidad; y  mas adelante tengan un buen trabajo, por esa razón ella acude a Fape para que se le otorgue su crédito y poder ella lograr lo que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo V. V., 47, is married and has three children.  She has worked making typical sweets for 12 years with her husband and children that help her make cocadas (coconut bars), higos (candied figs), camotes (candied sweet potatoes) and other varieties.

Consuelo used to not make much, just enough to stock her stand in Antigua’s market.  Because of lack of capital she was only able to make the bare minimum variety.  Because many people sought her out, however, she decided to solicit a loan from a Communal Bank although it was difficult for her because she wasn’t used to having debts.  However, facing the need to help her business grow she asked for 5000 quetzals and, thanks to God, earned good profits and became better known still for her delicious, fresh sweets.  She currently supplies sweets to Antigua’s best known hotels.

Now that her doors are open she wants to invest more so that the business will grow.  Her dream is to buy a large locale where she can work because she is currently working at home and this had caused problems in that the sweets she makes attract a lot of bees and this annoys her neighbors.  She also wants her children to get ahead and attend the university so that they can become professionals and have good jobs later on.  For these reasons she has called upon Fape to request a loan so that she can reach her goals.

loans.use: To make typical sweets.

loans.name: December 8 Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la señora Doralicia Benítez quien está domiciliadla en el Barrio San Roque de C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su barrio.
El comité se Denomina 8 de diciembre  están en el Noveno Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.
Todas las integrantes cuentan con una actividad independiente que realizan para sus ingresos, una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en un puesto que posee en su domicilio.
En su tienda cuenta con variedades de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños a precios muy accesibles ya que las mercaderías que ella vende son D. Brasil donde los precios son más competitivos.
Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su puesto de ventas como remeras, camisas, shorts, vestidos todo la temporada, primavera-verano.
texts.en:
Doralicia B., a resident of the community of San Roque de CDE, contacted her friends and neighbors to come together as a group.

This group is named December 8 and they are on their ninth loan cycle. There are 17 members and they are a group of very unified and responsible individuals. 

Each of the members has a business of their own and their own source of income. One of the members is Rosa and she sells clothing from a stand she has in her house.

In her store she has a variety of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children at very accessible prices. The merchandise she sells is from Brazil where the prices she gets are very reasonable.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her store such as jackets, shirts, shorts, and spring/summer dresses for every occasion.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
El señor Zacarías Z. M. es de la comunidad de Cotani Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba. Nació el 11 de de Junio de 1970 tiene 40 años, con tres hijos  que están en la escuela en su comunidad, la casa donde vive es con techo de paja con paredes de barro.

La actividad de don Zacarías es la agricultura trabaja solo con su familia, en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos ayudando entre ellos. El crédito que solicito es para comprar los insumos agrícolas. El objetivo de don Zacarías es de incrementar sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años con lo que está solicitando crédito.

En su comunidad produce papa, papalisa, haba y cereales la producción es estacional en la zona, es la parte alta de la Provincia y está ubicado a 8 km al norte del capital aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Mr Zacarías Z. M. is from the Cotani Alto neighborhood, in the province of Tiraque, in the department of Cochabamba.  He was born on June 11th 1970.  He is 40 years old and has three children who attend the local school.  The house where he lives has a straw roof and mud walls.

Zacarías is a farmer.  He works alone with his family and in some cases with the help of his neighbors who help each other.  The loan which he is requesting is to be used to purchase farming supplies.  Zacarías' goal is to increase his financial income over the next few years which is why he is requesting the loan.

In his community he produces potatoes, 'papa lisa' (a root crop common to the area), beans and cereals.  The production in the area is seasonal.  It is in the top part of the province and approximately 8km north of the capital.

loans.use: Working capital for farming work

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “El Sol Brilla para Todos” perteneciente a  la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella confecciona buzos, poleras, otros productos por encargos y hace composturas (arreglos), desde hace 10 años, en su casa. Tiene como clientes frecuentes 3 colegios, algunos jardines infantiles,  además de clientes particulares. Durante todo el año trabaja sola, pero los meses de enero y febrero contrata a una persona para que le ayude, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de colegios. Con este préstamo comprará una máquina de coser industrial, que es lo que le hace falta ahora, a pesar de tener actualmente 4 máquinas para diferentes usos. 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ampliar el espacio de su taller y abarcar a más clientes. 
Adriana está muy agradecida de la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza, tanto por los préstamos, como por los talleres sobre administración de negocios.  El taller que más le ha servido hasta ahora  fue el que le enseñó a registrar sus gastos y ganancias en un cuaderno de contabilidad, ya que de esta manera está organizando mejor su tiempo y dinero.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los bellos parajes y patios que posee. Se encuentra en la región de Valparaíso. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Adriana is part of The “El Sol Brilla para Todos” (The Sun Shines for Everyone) Communal Bank in the city of Viña del Mar. She has been working from home for over ten years making track suits, T-shirts and other items by order as well as making alterations. Amongst her steady clients are three schools, some kindergartens and individual clients. During the year she works alone, but in January and February she hires another person to help her because she receives many orders from schools at this time of year. 

With this loan she will purchase an industrial sewing machine. This is what she needs right now, even though she has four other sewing machines, which she uses for other work. Her goal is to continue expanding her business and increase both her workshop space and her client base.

Adriana is very grateful for the help from Fondo Esperanza, both for the loans they provide her and for the workshops, which they run regarding business administration. The workshop that has helped her the most up until now was the workshop that taught her how to record her expenditures and income in an accounts book, which has helped her to better organize both her time and her money.

Viña del Mar is both a city and a commune located in the region of Valparaíso on the central coast of Chile. It is known as the Garden City because of its beautiful places and courtyards and is considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: Industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Jeffren Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jeffren Antonio tiene 25 años, es casado El se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares. Desde hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio.  El se levanta desde muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, ya que es muy solicitado por los buenos servicios que ofrece. Además de que le gusta mucho este medio de vida, porque conversa con sus clientes de tecnología. El  motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima como repuestos, carcasas, display entre otras cosas. El se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jeffren Antonio is 25 years old, and married. He sells and repairs cell phones, and has been in this business for over 5 years. He gets up very early to serve his customers, as he is in great demand for the good service he offers. He also really likes this way of life, because he talks with his clients about technology.

The reason of the credit is to purchase raw materials such as spare parts, housings, displays, among other things. He pledges to pay his dues on time.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Señora Celia Isabel es cliente recurrente de la Función Paraguaya apartir del año 2009, está acompañada con señor Merardo Paredes y son padres de dos hijos, están domiciliados en el Barrio Santa Inés,  de la Ciudad de Presidente Franco.
Es de profesión comerciante, posee una despensa en su domicilio, en un conjunto de casa donde realiza la venta de varios artículos de primera necesidad, limpieza etc.
Actualmente solo está operando financieramente con nuestra Institución, siempre demostró un impecable comportamiento de pago con las obligaciones asumidas.
Son personas trabajadoras, honestas y con una visión de emprendedurismo.
Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como azúcar, harina, fideos, arroz, aceite, verduras, frutas y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Celia Isabel has been a repeat client at Función Paraguaya since 2009. She works with her partner, Merardo Paredes; they are parents of two children. They live in the Santa Inés neighborhood of the city of Presidente Franco.

Her profession is commerce. She has a store in her home, in a part of her house where she sells various basic necessities, cleaning products, etc.

Now she gets her financing only from our institution. She has always shown impeccable behavior in making her payments for the obligations she has assumed.

They are hardworking, honest people with an entrepreneurial vision.

They are applying for this loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, flour, pasta, rice, oil, fruits and vegetables, and other items for their store.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store, such as sugar, flour, pasta, rice, oil, fruits and vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Marianela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marianela Del Rocio B. C. tiene 35 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Marianela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y crianza de chanchos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y tener una economía familiar.

Le gusta ver  la televisión, jugar con la pelota, ayudar a ser las tareas de los hijos y festejar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marianela Del Rocio B. C., age 35, is in a common-law marraige.  She lives with her life partner and their children in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.  She has three children.

The members of the La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde (Never Lose Hope) Communal Bank belong to the Placer community or precinct.  It is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office.  Most of the members of this bank are farmers.

Marianela grows corn and cacao.  She also raises pigs.  She makes her purchases and sales at the Sunday fair in the Chillanes canton.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and feed for the animals.  

The support of the loan will financially help her to provide the necessities.  Her crops face the challenges of pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle and to have family savings.

She likes to watch television, play ball, help her children with their homework, and celebrate community fiestas.

loans.use: To buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Lizet M. B. es una mujer de 30 años de edad, ella no tine hijos, pero su situacion actual es un poco triste ya que hace apenas 5 meses fallecio su esposo, dejandola desprotegida, y con una tristeza enorme, ella se dedica a la venta de articulos variados de uso personal para damas mejor conocido como chacharas, este es el unico medio por el cual Lizet se mantiene, vive actualmente con sus padres en la comunidad de Lo de Soto, a 45 minutos de Pinotepa Nacional.
Su gran necesidad la obligo a solicitar un prestamo para la compra de mas mercancia, ella con ese capital pudo adquirir, labiales, barnis para uñas, diademas para el cabello, moños, pinzas para el cabello, articulos de fantasia, que son: aretes, pulceras, collares, añillos, lapiceras, y algunos boligrafos decorados.
En su actual actividad le va bien, y por lo menos le alcanza para sobrevivir con lo necesario, ya que su unica dependencia es su trabajo diario, ella nos comenta que es una situacion muy dificil por la que esta atravesando hoy en dia, y el ánimo que le queda es que la vida le ofrece la oportunidad de seguir adelante, luchando contra las adversidades y el unico enemigo a vencer el la triztesa, que poco a poco ella va superando.
Su reto mas grande es superar su pena, llevara tiempo pero ella ha dado elm primer paso que es la resignacion.
La esperanza mas grande es saber que la vida le ofrece muchas pruebas, asi como mucha oportunidades de salir adelante, demostrarce a si misma que se puede cuando se lucha con amor,a ella le gustaria tener algun dia su patrimonio propio y por el momento no si son muchos los planes que tiene, lo unico que hoy espera es superar pronto su pena y su dolor.
Lizet agradece a los que apoyaron en el fianciamiento de su credito, quienes quiera que sean solo le resta darles las gracias y un abrazo.
texts.en:
Lizet M. B. is 30 years old and does not have any children.  Her situation is a bit sad, because her husband passed away barely five months ago, leaving her unprotected and with an enormous amount of sorrow.  She sells various types of ladies’ articles, also known as “chacharas.”  This is her only means of support and she currently lives with her parents in the town of “Lo de Soto,” located 45 minutes from Pinotepa Nacional.

It was her great need that prompted her to request a loan to buy more merchandise, such as lipsticks, nail polish, hair accessories, ribbons, hair clips, and jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces, rings, and decorated pens.

She is doing well in her business and at least earns enough to survive, as her daily work is her only obligation.  She tells us that she faces a very difficult situation but still has some enthusiasm, knowing that life offers her the opportunity to get ahead.  She struggles against the challenges and sadness, but little by little she is winning.  Her biggest challenge is to beat her grief.  It will take time, but she has taken the first step, which is determination.

Her biggest source of hope is knowing that life offers many tests, as well as many opportunities to get ahead.  She wants to prove to herself that one can achieve when one works with love.  She would like to create her own legacy, but at the moment her only desire is to beat her grief and sorrow.

Lizet is grateful to those who have helped her get this loan, whoever they are.  She wants to say thank you and sends a big hug.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elmer Joel

texts.es:
Elmer Z., es habitante de la Comunidad El Rodeo, del Departamento de Esteli, casado, tiene 28 anos de edad, con 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura.
Inicio con su familia, ayudando en las actividades agricolas; pero al mismo tiempo con mucho sacrificio, decidio estudiar algo relacionado a lo que el sabia hacer, y realizo un Tecnico Agropecuario;  pero no pudo seguir mas alla de esa carrera tecnica, debido a las circunstancias economicas, y tuvo que seguir dedicandose a la siembra de Hortalizas.
A travez de los pocos conocimientos que logro obtener, ayudo a muchos de su comunidad realizando Capacitacion en Otorgacion de Creditos.
En la epoca de Invierno, se dedica a la compra/venta de productos agropecuarios, a las casa comerciales y empresasa como AGROALFA.
Realizo este credito para sembrar 1 manzana de Tomate, espera obtener buenas ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
Su meta es comprar mas terrenos, para tener mas variedad de cultivos y poder producir durante todo el ano.
texts.en:
Elmer Z. lives in the community of El Rodeo in the department of Esteli. He is married, 28 years old, and the father of 2. He is an agriculturist. 

He started out by helping his family with agricultural activities. But at the same time and with a great deal of personal sacrifice, he decided to study something related to what he already knew: agricultural technology. But he was not able to keep going with his technical training due to his financial circumstances. He kept his up his agricultural work. 

Through the knowledge he was able to acquire he helped many in his community to apply and secure loans. 

During the winter season he buys and sells agricultural products to businesses and to large companies like Agro Alfa. 

He requested this loan to cultivate tomatoes in a measure of land, with the hopes of earning a good income to support his family. 

His goal is to purchase more land, to have a larger variety of products to cultivate and to produce year-round.

loans.use: For his tomato harvest.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr Juan  labora como conductor es soltero  tiene cuatro personas  a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga,  este  desembolso lo necesita para compra de materiales  de construcción bloque ,hierro, cemento, arena, clavo, estribo para un cuarto en la vivienda.
texts.en: Juan works as a driver.  He is single and has four people in his care.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL.  He needs it to buy building supplies: blocks, iron, cement, sand, nails and beams, for a room in his home.

loans.use: Home improvements. To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Thiaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TIAAT est créé depuis trois ans et demi. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage, d'affinité et de parenté. le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOB SA JËKËR

Madame AIDA S. (debout à droite de la photo en pantalon noir et tricot rose) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. 

Elle fait un petit commerce d'encens et de parfums. Elle s'approvisionne soit à Touba (à environs 50 kilomètres) soit à la capitale du Sénégal (Dakar) 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de petit commerce et d'en faire la promotion. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
The Tiaat solidarity group was created three and a half years ago. It is composed of 15 women, all from the same neighborhood. They are linked by ties of neighborhood, kinship and affinity. The group is part of the Nob Sa Jeker “Banc Villageois”. 

Ms. Aida S. (standing right of the photo in black pants and pink sweater) is responsible for the group. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of one child.

She runs a small trade of incense and perfumes. She gets her supplies either from Touba (approximately 50 km) or from the capital of Senegal (Dakar).

Her new loan will enable her to improve her small business activity and promote it.

Her objective is to reinforce her savings at the “Banc Villageois” and support her husband in taking care of their family.

loans.use: Develop and promote her small business activity

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita P. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and widowed, with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelita runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells canned goods, snack foods, detergent, shampoo, soap and beverages. Amelita has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bread. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Amelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bread

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A., age 50, earns a living by raising livestock, specifically pigs, for fattening and sale. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP every three months. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She and her husband have three adult children. 

In 2008, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

She is presently requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase essential medication for her livestock. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mercy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase essential medication for her livestock

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married and has two teenage sons. He lives in the town of Kamenka, where he makes living selling souvenirs, various small products for the home, office supplies, plastic bags and other retail items. Gennadyi has been in this business for 10 years and currently has an inventory worth 70,000 Grivnyas. His net profit comes to about 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Gennadyi has made good use of two previous microloans and found them a very effective way to increase the success of his business. Now he is applying for a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to buy parts for bicycles because selling these items in spring makes a good business sense. He is hoping to generate extra income this season so that he can continue to grow his small business.

loans.use: to purchase parts for bicycles

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira B. is married and has three children. Along with her son, Zamira is engaged in animal husbandry, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Besides this business, she also sews national woman’s dresses. Zamira is requesting a loan of 12,000 Somoni, which will be used to  purchase cattle.  She will use the income to improve her living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.
