But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen, age 64, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business as a traditional cake seller, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who produces cement jars, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Pen and her husband have had these businesses. Pen is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Susan has a shop that sells cooked cashew nuts & peanuts. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy an additional sack of cashew nuts & peanuts.  

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sack of cashew nuts & peanuts

loans.name: Veronica Amalia

texts.es: Veronica es madre de 1 linda niña que tiene dos años y medio su esposo es cocinero de un restaurante de la capital, verónica se dedica a tejer Güipiles Típicos ella y le ha ido muy bien en este negocio ya que teje dos en el mes, ella termino de pagar un crédito y fue muy puntual por lo que nuevamente solicita otro para poder comprar hilo por mayor ya que esto le ayudaría a tener mas ganancias ya al comprar hilo por mayor sale mas barato y eso le tendría mucha cuenta, ella sueña en tener en un futuro mayores ingresos y así poder darle estudio a su hija para que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en: Veronica is the mother of one beautiful daughter who is two and a half years old. Her husband is a cook in restaurant in the capital. Veronica weaves güipiles (typical Guatemalan woven blouses). Her business is going well now that she is able to weave two in a month. She has finished paying her loan and was very punctual with her payments. Therefore, she is requesting one again in order to purchase thread. This would help her to earn more profit and purchase the thread at wholesale prices which is cheaper. She dreams of having a larger profit in the future, so that she can give her daughter an education and she can be a good person.

loans.use: purchase thread to make textiles.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is 40 years old and married to Samuel. Together they are blessed with one child. Juliah supplies milk in Kiamumbi. She has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES.10,000 per month. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business to other areas.

She hopes to expand her business and also wants to  buy cows so as to save and reduce on the cost of buying milk from suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase more stock (milk) and also buy a cow so as to save and reduce on the cost of buying milk from suppliers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

La señora Juana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, nos cuenta que son muchos años que ha estado en este banquito y le gusta porque con los créditos su familia ha podido salir adelante con su pequeño negocio. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 5 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 8 años los mismos que estudian  en  colegio y escuela y son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo  se dedica al comercio y además es artesano.

Ella realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en el negocio con el cual siempre ha mantenido el hogar, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que sus esposo se dedica a la venta de verduras y legumbres para lo cual recorre la localidad en un triciclo, trabaja tres días en sus ventas pero el resto de la semana de dedica a trabajar en una ladrillera del sitio donde vive, nos cuenta que con una sola actividad es muy difícil mantener un hogar por eso es necesario trabajar en todo lo que sea posible.
 
Este crédito es para comprar, habas, habichuelas, frejol, y todo tipo de legumbres y verduras para vender  a sus clientes. 

Sus sueños tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Juana is a founding member of the communal bank.  She tells us that she’s been in the communal bank for many years and likes it because the loans have made it possible for her family to get ahead with their small business.  She is 42 years old, married and has 7 children.  Five of them are adults and two, who are 16 and 8 years of age, are in secondary and elementary school respectively and still live at home.  Her husband’s a merchant and an artisan.

She is taking out this loan so that her husband can use it in the business which has always supported the household.  Our friend tells us that her husband crisscrosses the town on his three wheeled cart selling vegetables and legumes.  He works three days a week selling but the rest of the time he works at a brick factory where they live.  She tells us that it is very difficult to support a household with just one activity and this is why it’s necessary to work in everything possible.

This loan is to buy Lima beans, kidney beans, broad beans and all types of legumes and vegetables to sell to customers.  Her dream is to stay healthy and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy Lima beans, kidney beans, broad beans, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Margaret Auma

texts.en:
Margaret is a married lady with four children between 19 and five years old. She runs a tailoring services business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for six years and she says that her major challenge is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy fabric to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and in the future, employ many tailors to meet customer demands. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sew

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sol is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Sol has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the transport service.

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Diana es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha en el Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos mayores que ya están fuera de casa.
Desde hace poco trabaja con Manuela Ramos y sabe bien en que quiere invertir: se dedica al alquiler, refaccionó una parte de su casa para alquilero, es un negocio rentable.
Con su nuevo préstamo de PEN 2,000.00 comprará materiales para terminar la refacción del lugar: 8 planchas de triplay, 10 listones de 2x2, 1 ½ de clavos, 15 tapajuntas, 1 balde de pintura. Así puede empezar alquilar pronto a un buen precio y recibir mensualmente un ingreso. Su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad y solo está con ella pocos días.
Espera que todo vaya bien y que su esposo pueda quedar con ella. Gracias a Manuela Ramos Diana está realizando lo que tuvo pensado hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Señora Diana is a member of the communal bank "Las Colinas", which is in the Yarinacocha District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 43 years old, and is married with three grown children who have already left home.

She has not been working with Manuela Ramos for very long, and she knows well what she wants to invest in:  she does rentals; she has remodeled part of her home to rent out, and it has been a profitable business.

With her new loan of 2,000 PEN, she will buy materials to finish her remodeling: 8 sheets of plywood, 10 2x2 strips, 1 ½ kilos of nails, 15 pieces of flashing, and 1 bucket of paint.  In this way she will be able to soon start renting it out at a good price and receive a monthly income.  Her husband works outside of the city, and is only with her rarely.  She hopes that everything will go well, and that her husband will be able to stay with her.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Diana is achieving something that she has been thinking about for a long time.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish remodeling her rental space.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Felisa has a shop that sells electronic loads for several networks such as GLOBE, SMART & SUN CELLULAR. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy electronic loads to sell.

Felisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Felisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años es soltero y tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en San Gabriel. Se describe como una persona trabajadora y emprendedora.

Se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Trabaja con Fodemi por un tiempo de 5 años y el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de terneros para incrementar su negocio lo cual le ayudaría a mejorar su situación económica y su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old, single and has two children.  He lives with his family in San Gabriel.  He is know as a hard working and enterprising person.

He works with cattle and agriculture.  He has been working with Fodemi for 5 years and the currently requested loan is for the purchase of land to increase his business.  This will help him to improve his financial situation and his quality of life.

His dream is to have a stable business and to provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase land for his breeding.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 38 years old, is doing manual work from coconut, earning $7 per day. Her husband is a policeman, earning $3.5 per day. They have five children, three are studying, one is doing manual work, earning $3 per day. The youngest one is still too young to be in school. 

Every month, Thy has to spend $83 on food, $15 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a generator for her business. She wants to extend her career to have a big place that can produce more coconut products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Christine provides motorcycle or habal-habal services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for this service.

Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Cresbee

texts.en:
Cresbee is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cresbee has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Cresbee has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, one boy and two girls. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells charcoal which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the demand for juice is lower. Fatuma dreams of establishing a juice parlor in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a juice blender for making fruit juices for sale and also to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a juice blender for making fruit juices for sale and also to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Teresa es una de las socias de Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos, estudiantes de primaria y secundaria,  y con su compañero y padre de los niños. No tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, solamente término la escuela, debido a la condición económica tan difícil en la que vivía su familia, por ello se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven para contribuir con sus padres.  
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y con muchas ganas de superarse, realiza varias actividades productivas, como la avicultura, venta de huevos, también vende abarrotes, comestibles y otros productos para  el hogar. El crédito es de mucha ayuda porqué le va a permitir invertir en la compra de materia prima, como gallinas, pollos y alimentos. Sus objetivos son claros, y sus sueños son los que le dan la fuerza para seguir adelante, se ha propuestos; agrandar su gallinero y aumentar la producción de huevos, así como tener una pequeña pulpería en su casa, para colaborar con los ingresos de su hogar, darles estudios a sus hijos,  y en general mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Con Teresa, están Gerardina, Irene y Nidia que también va a invertir en la Avicultura.
texts.en:
Teresa is one of the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' Women's Bank.  She is 33 years old and lives with her two children, who are studying at elementary school and high school, and her partner (the children's father).  Teresa didn't have the opportunity to continue her education.  She only finished elementary school owing to the difficult economic circumstances in which her family lived.  She had to work from a very young age in order to contribute towards the household alongside her parents.

Teresa is a very hard-working woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She carries out a number of business activities such as poultry farming and selling eggs.  She also sells groceries, food and other household products.  This loan is very helpful because it will allow her to invest in buying raw materials such as hens, chickens and feed.  Her aims are clear and her dreams are what give her the strength to keep making progress.  Her goals are to expand her hen house and to increase her egg production.  She would also like to have a small grocery store in her home so that she can contribute towards her household income, provide her children with an education and generally improve her family's quality of life.

Together with Teresa are Gerardina, Irene and Nidia who will also invest in poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens and concentrate

loans.name: Kenyereye Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KENYEREYE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
FATOUMATA, assise à droite  fait le commerce de poissons (fumés et frais) il ya environ 5 ans. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux grandes caisses de poissons fumés.Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro à une fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the KENYEREYE group are married women with an average age of 38 years and have an average of 3 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Sikasso. They are on the first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, which continue to increase. 

FATOUMATA, sitting on the right, has been in the the fish business (smoked and fresh) for around 5 years. She intends to buy with her loan, 2 large cases of smoked fish. She stocks up in the big market in the town of Sikasso. 

She retails them for cash from a permanent family stall at Kamalen Sirakoro market to a customer base made up of men and women. She plans to make a monthly profit of 21,500 FCFA of which a part will be used for the daily expenses of the family and the other for savings. 

She aims to increase her business turnover in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is single, has one child, and operates a grocery shop, which she started three years ago. Jane also owns a boutique. 

Jane is applying for a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase new stocks of potatoes, onions, and oranges and to rebuild the kiosk. Her main challenge is that most of her produce is highly perishable; she must therefore rely upon good and committed clients. Jane would like to purchase a freezer to increase the shelf life of her produce but lacks the necessary funds. She will use the additional income to pay her utility bills, get good housing, and educate her child. She looks forward to establishing a larger store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and rebuild her kiosk.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and married to Carren. He has been in business for the last 6 years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 96,000 by selling used clothing. He is applying for his first loan of KES 80,000 to buy more stocks of second-hand clothes. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to expand his business by opening another shop.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur Bassirou est âgé de 21 ans. Il est célibataire et vit au Sénégal. Il exerce l’activité de charretier et s’adonne a la vente de bonbonnes de gaz. Il pratique aussi l’élevage de moutons. Il a choisi ses activités par nécessité dans le but de se procurer des revenus et de subvenir a ses propres besoins. Il est membre  de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de quelques brebis à élever et qui seront  destinés  a la vente .Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus pour être a mesure d’améliorer sa situation de vie sociale et aussi aider ses parents.
texts.en: Bassirou is 21 years old. He is single and lives in Senegal. He is a cart driver and sells gas cylinders.  He also raises sheep. Looking for a source of income, Bassirou has chosen these professional activities out of necessity, in order to support himself.  He has been a member of a local UIMCEC branch since July 2010.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 CFA francs in order to buy a few sheep that he will raise and ultimately resell.  His goal is to increase his income in order to improve his living conditions and to help his parents.

loans.use: to buy sheep that he will raise and ultimately resell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 35-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is seven months old. He describes himself as customer-friendly. He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, wheat flour, salt, sodas, tea leaves, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

William will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, sodas, and wheat flour. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, sodas, salt, flour.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin 27, is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, he has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. The high cost of transportation incurred in bringing goods to his stall poses a major challenge. Kelvin dreams of establishing another business in the future. With his KES 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and expand her pub business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Mr. M. has a workshop on the west side of the city where he does vulcanization. He has been in this business for 2 years and still has not been able to acquire proper equipment to do his work. Mr. M. says "I need a hydraulic tire changer and several pneumatic guns; these would help reduce 50% of the average time spent with each client, and to buy these tools I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. tiene una vulcanizadora de llantas automotriz en el poniente de la ciudad, lleva 2 años y aun no ha podido obtener el equipo adecuado para elaborar los trabajos. "Necesito una desmontadora hidráulica y varias pistolas neumáticas, esto me va a ayudar a reducir en un 50 % el tiempo promedio con cada cliente, para esto necesito $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Para comprar una desmontadora hidráulica y pistolas neumáticas.

loans.name: Prean

texts.en:
Mrs Prean T. is 34. She lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She makes mats for a living and earns 3 dollars per day.  Her husband works for a private company and earns 5 dollars per day. They have two children. 
They want to repair their house in order to be protected from the leaking in rainy season.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to be protected from the leaking during rainy season

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is 48 years old. She is an enterprising woman with grand desires of overcoming hurdles. She is married with three daughters, ages 21, 22, and 24. They have been her motivation for opening a jewelry, cosmetic and lingerie store 10 years ago in order to help out her spouse, their daughters’ educations and some expenses around the home. Fortunately, Maria Dolores has a great personality which allows her to get along with ease with others and her business, which was started among family members and friends, now has many more clients.

So that her business may continue to grow, Maria is asking for a loan of $650 dollars which she promises to repay in 6 months. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise to fulfill some requests and extend the variety of her products in order to offer her clients products for the new season. Please become a part of Maria’s achievements, she very much appreciates the opportunity that you are giving her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Dolores tiene 48 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella está casada y tiene tres hijas, de 21, 22 y 24 años de edad, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual desde hace diez años inició su propio negocio con la venta de joyería, cosméticos y lencería, para poder apoyar a su esposo con las colegiaturas de sus hijas y con algunos gastos del hogar, afortunadamente su carácter le facilita relacionarse con los demás y el negocio que inició entre familiares y amistades ahora ya tiene muchos más clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir unos pedidos que tiene y ampliar su variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de la nueva temporada. Forma parte de los logros de Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Mrs. Louise K., 32 years old, married and mother of 1 child, is a dressmaker. Due to the fact that she practices dressmaking with love and joy she has an unlimited number of customers. She is conscientious and has the ambition of becoming a great stylist and designer. She creates, by herself, wonderful designs that her customers truly appreciate. Her husband, oblivious to his responsibility as a father, leaves Mrs. Louise K. alone to face the needs of the family. A good manager, she succeeds in making ends meet with her small income. Wanting to accomplish the goal she set herself, she would like to purchase additional sewing machines that would be more efficient. Those machines would allow her apprentices to master the trade quickly, which would help her develop her business. Lacking the funds she is requesting a loan of $500. She promises to develop the full potential of her family once this project is in place because she is confident it would bring her great profit.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une (01) fille, Madame K. Louise est une couturière à 32 ans. La couture qu’elle exerce avec joie et amour fait qu’elle a un nombre illimité de clients. Dévouée et ayant l’ambition d’être une grande styliste et modéliste, elle crée elle-même de merveilleux modèles que ses clients apprécient tant. Son mari inconscient de sa responsabilité de père de famille, laisse Madame K. Louise seule face aux besoins de la famille. Bonne gestionnaire, elle arrive à joindre les deux bouts avec son petit revenu. Voulant à tout prix accomplir la mission qu’elle commencé, elle voudrait acheter d’autres machines plus efficaces ce qui permettrait à ses apprenties de vite maîtriser le métier en vue de l’aider à évoluer dans le travail. Faute de moyen, elle sollicite un crédit de $500. Elle promet assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille une fois ce projet réalisé car elle est confiant d’entier un profit maximum.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, 36, owns a barber shop in his home community. He is also a father of a 6-year-old and 4 year-old. He has been in business for six years. Over those six years, he’s become very popular; as a result, his store expanded rapidly. He now has two employees and boasts steady business.

Eventually, Nana would like to open more shops and hire more employees around Kasoa, but first he needs a loan to replace some of his barbering equipment. The weather in Ghana is very humid, which makes things wear and rust pretty quickly. Nana hopes to purchase new shavers, lights, decorations, and a sterilizer (which will help maintain the shavers).

Nana is a member of the lending group, Faith. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase electric shaver, sterilizer, lights, and decorations

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Salama G.. In 2005 she established a food processing business, where she produces chili sauces, mango chutney, honey and a range of other condiments and sauces. She now requires a loan of $450 to expand her range of delicious products. Salama is a widow and has four grown-up children. She cares for two of her grandchildren, Nandi, age 11, and Johary, age 9.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk for her food processing business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira works to make money to pay for the studies of her three young children. Every day she leaves her house to sell tender corn. All this began because in the jobs that she had, Elvira didn’t receive the money that she needed to help her husband with the expenses. It was because of this that she began to look for a better way of making the money she needed. Furthermore, she wanted to be her own boss. Nowadays she has various clients that look for her to buy the corn, and even cosmetics that she sells. However, these days she wants to add the sale of steamed tacos and sufficient material to be able to provide the tacos. With your support she can further her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira trabaja para poder sacar dinero para poder pagar los estudios de sus tres pequeños. Todos los días sale de su casa a vender elotes en un carretón. Todo comenzó porque en los trabajos que estuvo Elvira no recibía el dinero que necesitaba para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos. Fue por eso que comenzó a buscar la mejor manera de obtener el dinero que necesitaba. Además de que le gusta ser su propia dueña. Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que la buscan para comprarle elotes, además de cosméticos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente quiere agregar la venta de tacos al vapor para poder obtener mayores ganancias. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Elvira podrá comprar una vaporera y material suficiente para poder elaborar los tacos. Con tu ayuda podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mohammad Asif

texts.en: Mohammad Asif lives with his family in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated. He earned his degree in India but, after a long time of working in government, he decided to open a retail shop. His business is going well and he wants to expand it, so he requested an individual loan to buy necessary materials to attract more clients and to make good income to help his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his grocery store.

loans.name: Jiltañani Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION " JILTAÑANI" PERTENECE A PRO-MUJER HACE YA HACE VARIOS AÑOS CUENTA CON 17 SOCIAS, DICHO GRUPO TRAJAJA CON EL CENTRO FOCAL DE VILLA ADELA , UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO. PODRIAMOS DECIR QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS SOCIAS SON CASADAS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 3 HIJOS CADA UNA Y QUE ESTAS MANTIENEN ECONOMICAMENTE A SUS FAMILIAS. LAS ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN SON LAS VENTA DE CDS DE MANERA INFORMAL, TAMBIEN TRABAJAN CON LA VENTA DE FRUTA, QUE ESTA LA COMPRAN EN LOS MERCADOS AL POR MAYOR PARA LUEGO OFRECERLA AL POR MENOR; PERO LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL DENTRO LA ASOCIACION ES LA CONFECCION DE ROPA Y OTROS PRODUCTOS COMO SER: MOCHILAS, MALETINES, ESTUCHES ESPECIALES PARA CAMARAS, COMPUTADORAS ETC, ADEMAS DE LA CONFECCION DE ROPA CASUAL COMO SER: BLUSAS, FALDAS Y VESTIDOS. ELLAS AFIRMAN QUE NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA YA QUE PRINCIPAMENTE EL CUERO Y LAS TELAS SUBIERON DE PRECIO PARA ESTO SOLICITAN MAYORES CREDITOS, DE ESTA MANERA CONTINUAR CON SU TRABAJO Y ASI OBTENER GANANCIAS PARA PODER SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA YA QUE PRINCIPAMENTE EL CUERO Y LAS TELAS SUBIERON DE PRECIO.

THE "JILTAÑANI" ASSOCIATION HAS BELONGED TO PRO-MUJER FOR SEVERAL YEARS AND NOW HAS 17 MEMBERS; THIS GROUP WORKS WITH VILLA ADELA COMMUNITY LOCATED IN THE EL ALTO. MOST OF THE MEMBERS ARE MARRIED WITH AN AVERAGE OF 3 CHILDREN EACH WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY SUPPORTING THEIR FAMILIES. MANY OF THEM SELL CDS IN THE INFORMAL MARKET, THEY ALSO SELL FRUIT BY BUYING IT IN THE MARKET AT A WHOLESALE PRICE AND THEN SELLING IT FOR LESS; BUT THE MAIN ACTIVITY WITHIN THE ASSOCIATION IS THE TAILORING OF CLOTHING AND OTHER PRODUCTS: BACKPACKS, SUITCASES, COMPUTERS AND CAMERA CASES, ETC. IN ADDITION THEY MAKE CASUAL CLOTHING LIKE: SHIRTS, SKIRTS AND DRESSES. THEY NEED MORE CAPITAL FOR THE PURCHASE OF RAW MATERIALS, SPECIFICALLY SINCE THE PRICE OF LEATHER AND CLOTH WENT UP CREATING THE NEED FOR HIGHER LOANS. THIS WILL ALLOW THEM TO CONTINUE WORKING AND OBTAINING PROFITS TO SUPPORT THEIR FAMILIES.

loans.use: NEED MORE CAPITAL TO PURCHASE RAW MATERIALS SINCE LEATHER AND FABRIC PRICES INCREASED

loans.name: Chérif

texts.fr:
Chérif G., age 37, is married and a mother with six children to care for.  She has been a loyal member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for two years.  She want to buy an embroidering machine, poplin cloth, and some packets of sewing thread.  She has a sewing shop where she sells poplin and clothing, which she makes.  Chérif is a loyal member and is exemplary in her group.  With her income, she is helping to improve her family's living conditions.   The loan for which she is applying will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

 Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Chérif G., 37 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants en charge est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 2 ans. Elle veut  acheter une machine à coudre broderie, des tissus popeline et des paquets de fil à coudre. Elle a un atelier de couture ou elle vend de la popeline et des tenues qu'elle confectionne. Chérif est une fidèle membre et un modèle dans son groupe Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine, poplin, and thread

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
Patricia is 34 years old, is married and lives in Florencia de Mora District, Trujillo Province in the region of La Libertad. She studied at the post high-school level and is a computer technician, but she isn't practicing currently. She has one 8 year old son that studies at a school in the district.

She has a workshop in her house, in which she makes gold and silver jewelry and distributes it to the jewelry shops in the city center. She has this business with her husband and they also have a kiosk, which was started 5 years ago, where they sell sodas, cookies, mineral water and sweets. With the first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevo Soles provided last year by the Manuela Ramos organization she bought gold and silver as well as the other supplies necessary for her business. Patricia joined the “Unidas Para Un Futuro Mejor ” community bank by invitation of her neighbors.

With the current loan of 800 Peruvian Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in supplies in order to make her jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Patricia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; estudió superior, ella es técnica en computación pero no lo ejerce últimamente, tiene 01 hijo de 08 años el cual estudia en el colegio del distrito.

Tiene un taller en su casa, en el cual elabora joyas de oro y plata y lo reparte en los joyerías del centro de la cuidad; este negocio lo realiza con su esposo, también tienen quiosco en el cual vende gaseosas, galletas, agua mineral, y golosinas, ella se inicio en este negocio hace 05 años y con el primer préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, el año pasado el cual fue de S/.300. nuevos soles, compró oro y plata en bruto y los demás insumos necesarios para la realización de su trabajo. La señora Gladis ingresa al Banco Comunal “Unidas Para Un Futuro Mejor ” por invitación de sus vecinas ;

Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.800.00, debiendo cancelarlo en 4 meses, el cual también lo invirtió en insumos para la elaboración de las joyas.

loans.use: Buying more products for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 40 years old, joined TYM since 1995.  Her family original occupation is husking rice.  Therefore, in her first loan, she borrowed 500 thousands VND to buy pigs for breeding as she can used the bran from rice-husking as foodstuff for the pigs.  In 1999, her family became a small retailer, selling bran, corn and rice as foodstuff for breeding cattle.  Since her first loan, the total amount of money she borrowed from TYM had totaled up to about 90 million VND.  With this suitable occupation, her family had been able to buy car and trucks and open up a transportation services in the area.  As her 4 children are still going to school, the one who helped her the most had been her hard-working husband.  This cycle, she would like to borrow 19 million VND to buy more foodstuffs.  Income from her two business is around 8 million VND monthly

 Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đông 40 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị làm nghề xay sát gạo. Năm 1995 chị vào Quỹ và vay vốn vòng 1 số tiền 500.000 đồng mua lợn về chăn nuôi để tận dụng cám, gạo trong xay sát. Từ năm 1999 gia đinh chuyển sang làm đại lý cám, ngô, gạo là thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi, từ khi tham gia Quỹ tổng số vốn gia đình chị vay từ quỹ là 90.000.000đ. Với việc làm kinh tế phù hợp đến nay gia đình chị đã mua được ô tô, xe lam để kinh doanh vận tải, chị có 4 con hiện nay các con chị vẫn đang đi học, chồng chị là người chịu khó, biết chia sẻ công việc và luôn sát cánh cùng chị trong việc kinh doanh. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000 đầu tư vào kinh doanh cám, ngô thức ăn chăn nuôi.
  Thu nhập từ kinh doanh cám, ngô và dịch vụ vận tải khoảng 8.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: Business  animal food

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. buys fish in large quantities, and then sells the fish in smaller and affordable quantities to her costumers. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. But his income is not sufficient for Mary and her 2 children.

Mary has many customers. She is asking for a loan for additional capital so she can purchase more fish to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more fish in bulk to sell

loans.name: Jina's Asaa Kheri Group

texts.en:
Jina is 33 years old and is married with 5 children ages 13, 9, 7, 5 and 2. She has been selling charcoal and firewood since 2003. She works from 7am to 6pm everyday of the week and earns a monthly profit of about $30.

Jina has previously taken out 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to start her business and has successfully repaid them both. Jina now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with fish and bites sales, clothing sales, tailoring, firewood and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with four children, who are 20, 17, 15, and 12 years old. Since 2005, she has owned a small restaurant and has also been a batik seller. She works every day at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Hidaya has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding new items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding new items to her current stock.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim O., 43, works as a rice farmer, making $4 per day. Her husband runs a business charging batteries in his community. The battery charging business is doing well as most people use batteries to generate electricity, given that there are no power lines running to the community. Yim O.'s husband makes five dollars on a typical day. The couple has applied for a loan to purchase a charging machine that enables them to recharge batteries faster and more efficiently, what should be a profitable investment. (Mr. O. is pictured).

loans.use: To buy a charging machine that enable her husband to charge many batteries in a time.

loans.name: Dolly Dermis

texts.es:
La señora Dolly pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 168, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de jugos y hamburguesas, todas las mañanas vende en el patio de su hogar, brindándoles buena atención a sus clientes.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 3 kilos de betarraga, 7 papayas, 4 kilos de manzanas, 3 docenas de huevos, etc.

Dolly manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante, teniendo fe y entusiasmo para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolly S. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on Nº 168 Progreso Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are no longer her dependants. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in beauty product sales.

She currently sells hamburgers and juice every morning on her patio, providing excellent customer service.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 3 kg of beets, 7 papayas, 4 kg of apples, 3 dozen egg, etc.

Dolly states that all women can get ahead in life, as long as they have faith and enthusiasm for work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beets, papayas, apples, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Estelbina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Estelbina S. se dedica a laborar en su tramo donde prepara alimentos para su venta en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosos alimentos que son comercializados con mucho empeño y como resultado atiende varios clientes en su sector. 

La única razón por la cual ella ha buscado hoy en día el apoyo en Ceprodel es para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Es por este motivo que solicita un crédito en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar en su actividad preparando los deliciosos alimentos.
texts.en:
Estelbina S. prepares food that she sells in the Central Market of the city of Chinandega. She has made a name for herself by preparing delicious meals that she then sells with much determination. Consequently, she serves several customers in her area.

The only reason why she is now seeking Ceprodel’s support is that she needs to purchase more ingredients to prepare her meals. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel, hoping that she will be given a loan so that she can continue with her business of making delicious meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Abduhamit

texts.en:
Abduhamit F. is a 26-year old man. Abduhamit and his wife, who is a housekeeper, have been married for almost 4 years and have two wonderful kids. Abduhamit has been running his own small business for one year. He has a store that sells shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste, brushes and other items. Abduhamit is very friendly and polite which attracts clientele. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($ 875 USD) so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale. Abduhamit promises to pay his loan during a 10 month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, contains epic mountain passes, and is a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale and to expand offerings.

loans.name: Silvia Castro

texts.es:
Silvia Castro A. es una joven señora de 26 años de edad que vive en las llanuras de la zona norte de Costa Rica, en una pequeña comunidad llamada San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos. San Rafael es una comunidad rural en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la cría de ganado tanto para carne como para leche. Es una zona de clima caliente, la cual también es muy visitada por turistas que viajan a ver lugares el volcán Arenal, ríos con agua celeste, aguas termales, lagunas, montañas y otras bellezas naturales que se mantienen en la zona. Cerca de la zona también se produce agricultura, principalmente el cultivo de piña, yuca, naranjas y frijoles.
Silvia está casada con Carlos García y tienen una pequeña hija de dos meses de nacida que se llama Jimena. Silvia y Carlos trabajan juntos en una finca de 12 hectáreas que alquilan y en la cual también tienen una casa donde viven. En esta finca crían ganado desde hace dos años. Su familia tiene una amplia tradición ganadera ya que tanto su papá como su abuelo se dedicaban a esto. Silvia también está luchando para terminar sus estudios en la universidad, la cual va pagando con los ingresos que recibe por las actividades en la finca.
Con el deseo de tener más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir estudiando, Silvia requiere un micro crédito que le permita comprar tres terneros así como medicinas y vacunas para su desarrollo. Con el préstamo de US$ 1.000 espera invertir US $800 para comprar tres terneros y US $200 para comprar vitaminas, desparasitantes, vacunas, sal, minerales y melaza. El ganado lo espera vender en una de las tantas subastas cercanas a su comunidad. 
Silvia forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Florencia, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia este será el primer préstamo que reciba, pero ya ha realizado inversiones de capital como socia. Con este préstamo ella espera mejorar su negocio y de esta forma la lograr una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia Castro A. is a young woman of 26 who lives in the small community of San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos, in the North of Costa Rica. San Rafael is a rural community where most people raise livestock for milk and meat. It has a warm climate and is very popular with tourists who come to see the Arenal volcano, the clear blue rivers, hot springs, lakes, mountains and the natural beauty of the region. Pineapple, cassava, oranges and beans are some of the crops grown in the surrounding agricultural areas. Silvia is married to Carlos García and they have a two-month-old daughter named Jimena. Silvia and Carlos work together on a 12-hectare farm which they rent; this is also where their home is. They have been raising livestock on this farm for two years. Her family has a long tradition of raising livestock as both her father and grandfather were in the livestock business. Silvia is also working hard to finish her university degree which she pays for with the revenues from farming. Because she wants to increase her income to improve her quality of life and be able to continue studying, Silvia needs a microloan of USD $1,000. She will invest USD $800 in the purchase of three calves and USD $200 to buy vitamins, medecine for deworming, vaccines, salt, minerals and molasses. She plans to sell the cattle at one of the many local auctions. Silvia is part of the Florencia community bank, one of the more than 100 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan as a member, but she already has savings with the bank. She hopes to improve her business with this loan and thus achieve a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three calves, medecine and vaccines.

loans.name: Raman

texts.en: Raman O. is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  To support his family, he sells motor spare parts.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more motor spare parts for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional motor spare parts

loans.name: Zuli Maribel

texts.es:
Zuli es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Zuli es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Zuli es Técnica en Enfermería y trabaja en el hospital, también vende salchipollo todas las tardes de manera ambulatoria cerca al mercado de la Magdalena, y en Semana Santa vende comida.
Zuli necesita un préstamo de 1000 S., dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, aceite y mayonesa.
El sueño de Zuli es mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio, mejorar su casa y sacar profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zuli is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. She is married, is 32 years old and has 2 children. Zuli is a licensed vocational nurse who works in a hospital. She also peddles salchipollo (fried chicken and french fries) every afternoon near the Magdalena market and during Easter week she sells meals. Zuli needs a loan of 1000 S., money she will invest in the purchase of potatos, oil and mayonnaise. Zuli’s dream is to improve her business, to have a proper location for food sales, to improve her house and to get professional for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, oil and mayonnaise for food sales

loans.name: Liua

texts.en: Liua T. is 29 years old and married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the Pancake, Taro and Banana Chips business. She sells to children in school and people in her village 5 days per week. Liua needs a loan to expand her chips business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (~39 USD).  SPBD loans are Liua’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Liua wanted to bake chips and pancakes herself to earn extra money in addition to the items in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags, dripping/oil, salt, flour, baking appliances for the baking.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma N., 31, is married to Marito N., a van driver. They are blessed with three children and live in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Her business is the buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothes (RTW). She sells to her friends and neighbors. She borrowed 20,000php for additional capitalization of her business. Her income helps with the daily needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy stock of RTW clothes

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en: Mrs. Emerencia A. is 58 years old. She is married with 6 children- 5 are married and 1 is still studying in secondary school. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental,Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. She started her business when she became a member of Paglaum MPC in April 2005. She is now on her 8th loan cycle, and is seeking Php6,000.00 for additional capital for her sari-sari store- to buy additional stocks such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated an excellent loan repayment record. She aims to have a successful business and would eventually like to have a concrete store and be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Mt Mdizunga Group

texts.en:
Joyce A., age 41, is married with four children, ages 20, 17, 14 and 8. She has had a food business since 1990. She works daily from 8am until 12noon. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $148 

This will be Joyce’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more food items to sell at Tegeta Primary school. She has repaid the loans successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to buy a stove to start baking cakes and bread. 
 
Joyce will share this loan with her subgroup A, Mt Udizungwa, which totals 6 members. The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Joyce is 1st on the left.

loans.use: To buy a stove for baking cakes and bread.

loans.name: Carlos Caín

texts.es: Carlos Caín M. de 36 años de edad, reside en Santa Ana junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Él posee un negocio en el cual se encarga de fabricar y vender ladrillos para construcción. El solicita un préstamo ya que espera obtener el capital necesario para comprar mucha más materia prima y elaborar más ladrillos, ya que su demanda es muy alta y es necesario que elabore mas ladrillos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos Caín M. is 36 years old and lives in Santa Ana with his life partner and two children. He owns a business that makes and sells bricks for construction. He is requesting a loan because he hopes to obtain the necessary capital to purchase much more raw materials and make more bricks because the demand is very high and he needs to make more bricks in order to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials needed to make bricks

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (1007060189) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, B. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, B. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. B. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her eighth from TYM Fund. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica G. is a single parent with one child. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Since 2006, Monica has sold fresh eggs in Abura. Monica uses her income to pay for house-keeping expenses. Monica will use the loan to purchase more crates of eggs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to re-invest.	

In the photo, Monica is holding some egg crates on top of her head as an example of what she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Alicia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Alicia del Socorro R. de 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Camilo Chamorro en la capital de Managua,  tiene dos hijos mayores de edad,  su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace treinta años logro administrar, también vende medicamentos y productos escolares todo esto lo logro con ayuda de su esposo. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar granos básicos, carnes, leche y otros productos de consumo diario. Con este préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que lograra sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Alicia del Socorro R., 61, lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has two grown children. She has run her mini market for 30 years. She also sells medicines and school products. She achieved all of this with help from her husband. She wants the loan to buy basic grains, meat, milk, and other daily consumption products. She expects to get greater earnings with this loan. She is grateful to the institution for the support of the loans in achieving her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and daily consumption products

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo Luis, quien es chofer, y sus hijos: Fabricio de 25, Sandra de 13 y Astrid de 24 días de nacida. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a domicilio, actividad que le da el dinero necesario para apoyar con las necesidades del hogar. Pues como los ingresos de su esposo no logran cubrir todos los gastos, Tania trabaja para obtener ganancias adicionales. Si bien tiene que dedicar tiempo a sus hijos y trabajar, este negocio se lo permite, pues luego de realizar las labores domésticas sale a visitar a sus vecinas, amigas o familiares a ofrecer su mercadería. Tania compra gran cantidad de productos, en especial los que están en oferta y luego los vende a su precio real, es así que gana un buen porcentaje de la venta. Hasta ahora le está yendo bien en su negocio, por lo que desea perfeccionar más su metodología de venta. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y en sus créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser muy puntual con los pagos, ya que los invierte correctamente. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para tenerla en stock, además ayudará a pagar la reparación del carro de su esposo, ya  que necesita llantas nuevas y actualizar el seguro obligatorio.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería y reparación del carro de su esposo

loans.name: Shirmammad

texts.en:
Shirmammad S. is a humble man who earns a living in the cattle-farming business. He is the father of six daughters, who motivate him to work harder every day to be able to meet their needs. As he is a very respectable man in the village he lives in, Shirmammad is responsible for providing all his daughters with a good dowry.

It is important to note that Shirmammad’s business requires a lot of physical work, mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. Shirmammad pastures his cattle without any help and continues to work hard. He has now come to AqroInvest to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, de 38 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos, tres mayores y uno menor de edad, tiene un kiosco en su casa donde oferta sus productos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en una empresa maderera. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza”, desde hace dos años. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles que invirtió en productos para su kiosco.  Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, comprará bebidas como gaseosas, néctar, jugos, agua mineral, etc. La meta de Julia es tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender productos de todas las líneas, como golosinas, abarrotes en general, útiles escolares, ferretería, artículos de cocinas,etc

loans.use: Invertirá en compra de bebidas como gaseosas, néctar, jugos, agua mineral, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed Jayah

texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed Jayah W. has two wives and a total of fifteen children. Four of the children are in secondary school, three in primary school, and the rest have yet to start school. He sells local foodstuffs (palm oil and garrie). He has been in business for 20 years at the main Lorry Park.

He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase additional local foodstuffs to sell to business people in the township of Bo and Guinea. One of his wives is a businesswoman; the other is a matron at the children's home. 

He is assisted by four boys whom he pays on a daily basis. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay his children's university fees and maintain the home.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and garrie

loans.name: Sun Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun Maiya T. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region and is one of the least developed villages of lalitpur. This makes the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in her family, including herself. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, husband and three daughters. Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Hat Raj T. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. As the region is hilly, they face lots of problem in agricultural farming. Now Mrs. T. is requesting her first term loan of Rs10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Odontungalag

texts.en:
D. Odontungalag is 31 years old and lives with her two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her two children live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son currently attends a local secondary school and her youngest daughter is only two years old. Odontungalag operates a small clothing production business in her town with the help of her relatives. Her business is especially busy during the winter and also during the wedding season in Mongolia. She produces a variety of warm traditional Mongolian clothes during the winter and makes beautiful dresses for the many brides during the warmer months of the year.

Odontungalag started her business in 1998 and has built a stable operation over the years. At first she had only manual sewing machines but has used her earnings to purchase 2 electric sewing machines. She has gained much experience as a businesswoman over the years and has improved her skills as a seamstress. Her business has provided financial security for her family and has enabled her to provide for her children's education. Odontungalag is focuses on the future and hopes to continue to grow her business. She says, "This coming winter is going to be an especially cold one. For that reason, I plan to produce warm Mongolian traditional shoes in addition to clothes." Odontungalag is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase materials used in making traditional shoes. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase materials used in making traditional shoes.

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamella N. is a happy mother of four children. She is 60 years old and married. Tamella is a grocery store owner. For more than 15 years she has been selling foodstuff such as sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many other products in her grocery store. Tamella’s wish is to expand her business, offering various types of foodstuff to customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children, who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, with the immense love Tamella feels as a mother, and with her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Tamella.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian A. D. C. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su hija D. cuatro años D. edad. Ana posee una venta D. productos perecederos, la cual la posee desD. hace cinco años, y es la cual le ha permitido tener una vida estable, ya que pueD. ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda con productos como embutidos, comida enlatada y otros productos más los cuales son D. primera necesidad. Ella desea aumentar sus venta ya que el próximo año su pequeña hija inicia sus estudias y como toda madre responsable, Ana desea poder comprarle todo lo necesario a su niña para que asista a clases.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian A. D. C., 45, lives with her husband and their 4-year-old daughter in the city of Colón, department of La Libertad. Ana has a store selling perishable goods that she has operated for five years. This business has enabled her to have a stable life, as she can help her husband with the household expenses. Ana is seeking a loan to stock her store with products such as processed meats, canned goods, and other basic food products. She wants to expand her business because her daughter begins school next year and, like any responsible mother, she wants to buy everything her daughter will need to attend classes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic food products for store

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz M. is from the village of Magcamiguing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Maria Luz is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Luz sell firewood in the local community. Maria Luz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maria Luz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. Maria Luz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to buy more firewood to sell. This will be Maria Luz's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To more firewood to sell

loans.name: Leticia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Leticia Guadalupe S. H. es soltera y desde que inicio los créditos con Ceprodel ha venido comprando materiales para construir su casa propia casa con este ultimo crédito va a comprar madera para entechar así como zinc ya que la temporada de invierno se aproxima.
texts.en:
Sra. Leticia Guadalupe S. H. is single. Ever since she started receiving loans from CEPRODEL, she has used to proceeds to purchase materials necessary to build her own home. This latest loan will be used to buy wood and zinc roofing in order to prepare for the upcoming winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood & zinc roofing

loans.name: Gertudes

texts.en:
Grertudes B. is from the village of East Poblacion in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old and married, and has 2 adult children. 

To make a living, Gertudes provides rooms for rent in the local community. Gertudes has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gertudes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gertudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Gertudes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to create more rooms for rent. This will be Gertudes's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to have more rooms to rent

loans.name: Roem

texts.en:
Mrs. Roem T. is a villager who lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn Sann, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their family living. Thus, Mrs. Roem T. decided to start a new business raising pigs.

Mrs. Roem T. is now requesting KHR 2,000,000 from AMK to buy fifteen piglets, pig food and to build a pigpen. With the loan she hopes to increase her income and improve her family too.

Mrs. Roem T. is 31 years old and the mother of four children who all are students in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fifteen piglets, pig food and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Strong Business People Group

texts.en:
Sando G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Strong Business People.  Her business is selling soup, rice, and cold water at the Red Light Market, located on the outskirts of Liberia's capital Monrovia.  She says she will use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy rice, oil, fish, and charcoal to use at her food stall.

Sando is 32 years old, married, and has one boy and two girls, aged 11, 14, and 18, respectively.  Her children are all in school.  Sando herself was only able to complete school through the 9th grade due to the Liberian civil war, which disrupted her education.

Besides her children, Sando also helps care for her younger brother, who is 23 and lives with at her house with her family.

Sando started her business selling prepared food -- soup and rice -- about seven years ago.  She says she started small, selling cold water out of a container with only three cups to serve her customers.  Her business has grown, but it's hard work.  She wakes most days at 5:30 in the morning, is at the market by 8, and stays until dusk.  She hopes that one day her work will be easier on her.

If she's successful in business, Sando hopes she and her family will be able to build a house on the land they own.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sando is the one holding the sign.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, fish, and charcoal in order to make dishes served at a food stall.

loans.name: Olusade

texts.en:
Olusade has a grinding machine, which she uses to grind foodstuffs like beans, corn, tomatoes, peppers, etc. She also sells foodstuffs like garri, rice and yam flour. She buys in large quantities and sells to retailers. She is very hardworking since she has to leave home as early as 5am to be able to get goods to buy. She has been in this business for six years and with this, she helps her husband in providing for the family. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a discount to resell.

Olusade is 49 years old, married and has five children. She says thank you to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amador Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amador está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y admirables una de ellas es la señora Petrona Pérez García quien en el 2003 con la venta de una vaca y un cerdo invirtió en la compra de cosméticos, celulares, computadoras, radios entre otro productos que junto con su nieta comercializa en Costa Rica formando así un dúo dinámico. 

Su compañera Dina Ramírez desde hace siete años venta de ropa y prendas de oro y Janeth del Carmen F. R. comercializa ropa, zapatos y churros en la zona franca.
texts.en:
The Amador group consists of three hard-working and admirable women. One of the members is Petrona Pérez García, who with the money from selling a cow and a pig in 2003 invested in the purchase of cosmetics, cell phones, computers, radios and other products that she along with her granddaughter sell in Costa Rica as a dynamic duo. Fellow members Dina Ramírez has sold clothing and gold jewelry for the past seven year and Janeth del Carmen F. R. sells clothing, shoes and churros in the French zone.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and household appliances

loans.name: Thaen

texts.en: Mr. Thaen K. is a villager in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. He is 42 years old. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell to support his family. His problem is that his field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mr. Thaen K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. His wife, Mrs. Thara Soun, is a farming laborer. He is the father of four children. One of his children is a soldier, two are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other is studying in the local public school. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina  tiene 61 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, esta casada con el Sr. Pedro de 51 años , quien es plomero y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente de los cuales dos viven con ellos.
Aquilina inició su actividad hace más de 40 años, vendiendo ropas con su hermano en forma ambulante recorriendo casa por casa, actualmente trabaja con ella un hijo a quien les enseña el oficio de las ventas.
Es muy valorada por su actitud emprendedora, pues desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de dicho producto, gracias a eso y a su buena administración está pudiendo tener una mejor calidad de vida .
Necesita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, como camperas, remeras mangas largas, medias, bufandas, y otros diferentes abrigos de modo a satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Aquilina is 61 years old and sells clothing. She is married to 51 year old Pedro who works as a plumber and helps with the household expenses.
