They have five children, all fully grown but two live at home. Aquilina started her business more than 40 years ago, selling clothing door to door with one of her brothers. One of her sons works with them now and she is teaching him the business. She is very valued for her entrepreneurial activities and she has been selling clothing since she was a young girl. Thanks to this and her good management skills, she has been able to have a better quality of life. She needs this loan in order to buy winter clothing, such as jackets, long sleeve shirts, socks, scarves, and other different types of coats to satisfy her customer demand and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Winter clothing inventory

loans.name: Adelia Carina

texts.es:
La señora Adelia Carina Fernández  M.,  tiene 36  años de edad, recientemente se caso con Sergio David Sánchez juntos a su hijo viven en la comunidad de mayra provincia de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   Adelia y su esposo se dedican a trabajan hace mas de 18 años en la agricultura lo que más producen es cebolla y zanahoria.

Junto a su esposo la señora Adelia  lograron comprar un lote y desean construir una casita, la señora Adelia  es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de mizque, por lo dedicada a su familia y su trabajo ella está solicitando el crédito para poder comprar más insumos para  dedicarse más a la agricultura y aumentar su producciones y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia casa.  El crédito ayudara a alcanzar más rápido el sueño de  doña Adela.
texts.en:
Adelia Carina Fernández M. is 36 years old, and recently married Sergio David Sánchez. Together with their son, they live in the Mayra community, located in the Mizque province of Cochabamba. For more than 18 years, Adelia and her husband have dedicated themselves to farming. Their largest crops are onions and carrots. Adelia and her husband managed to buy a plot of land where they wish to build a little house. Adelia is very loved and respected in the town of Mizque, for her dedication to family and work. She is requesting a loan to buy more farming supplies, to increase her production, and to fulfill her wish of having her own home. This loan will help Adelia accomplish this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Flora is 42 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de frutas en el interior del mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece a sus clientes frutas frescas de estación, el negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que este centro de abastos es el principal de la localidad, Miguelina siempre atiende a sus clientes con un trato amable, por lo que cuenta siempre con un grupo de clientes fidelizados.

Miguelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.

Miguelina es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa, diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder percibir mayores ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 60, is a mother who lives with her husband and children in the San Pedro de Lloc district which is part of Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the last ten years she has been a fruit vendor inside her town’s market. She stocks seasonal fresh fruit. Her business is well received because this is the area’s main foodstuffs market. Miguelina always tends to her customers with kindness so she has a group of regular customers she can count on. Miguelina would like to expand her stock of merchandise to increase her sales and generate higher profits. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. Miguelina is a hard working, dedicated person who puts in the greatest effort daily in order to earn the best profits and help her family succeed. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has always repaid in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Junia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Junia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es casada ella tiene 2 hijos, La socia es contadora de profesión, ella alterna sus actividades con la contabilidad, La socia  trabaja en la distribuidora rio negro, La socia desea mejorar su casita y también pagar una mensualidad de su hijo en la universidad, ella pagará con su sueldo poco a poco la deuda. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar una mensualidad de su hijo y para mejorar su casa con una parte.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Junia, a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank (Choquequirao is a ruined Incan city; the name is Quechua for “cradle of gold”). He lives in the Huanchac district, located in the province and department of Cusco. Junia is 43 years old, she is married and has 2 children. She is an accountant, and she alternates her accounting activity with a job in a supermarket in Rio Negro. She desires to improve her house and also to pay a university installment for her son. She will repay her debt little by little with her wage. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay a monthly installment for her son and to make improvements in her house. She is really thankful and endlessly values the loan she has been granted, as this allows her to improve the quality of her life; at the same time she commits to complying with paying her dues at the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay a monthly installment for her son and to make improvements in her hous

loans.name: Shayamie

texts.en:
Shayamie A. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Shayamie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Shayamie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks for the local community. Shayamie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 85,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Shayamie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shayamie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shayamie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Luisana Isabel

texts.es:
Luisana de 24 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber-game en su casa,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Por la falta de oportunidades el papa le compro una computadora y ella comenzó a utilizarla para hacer trabajos y alquilarla con un play station que ella tenia comenzó a generarle ingresos para seguir con este negocio. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. La hora de Internet la alquila a $0.50c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para tener ya un Cyber establecido. En el futuro quiere tener mas surtido su Cyber para asegurar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luisana is 24 years old and has a small cybercafé-gaming arcade in her home. She lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the region was discovered.

Due to a lack of opportunities, her father bought her a computer and she began using it to generate work. She also rented out a PlayStation console that she owned and started generating income to continue her business. Luisana now works every day from 8am until 10pm. She rents out Internet booths for $0.50/hour.

With this loan she plans to buy computers so that she can have an established cybercafé. In the future, she wants to keep her cybercafé well-equipped so that she can secure her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter works in a secondary school as an English teacher. The second daughter is studying at university with graduation next spring. The youngest son studies at secondary school. 

Mrs. Oyuntsetseg’s family used to live in Uvurkhangai Aimag, a southwest province of Mongolia, and she was a teacher in kindergarten. Her husband used to be a herder raising livestock. In 1996, they lost almost all their livestock because of the harsh winter in Mongolia. Then, they had to move to Ulaanbaatar city in search of a better life, but they could not find any suitable jobs for them. She and her husband decided to collect different kinds of recyclable waste and sell it to waste exporting and recycling companies for a profit. Now they have an established business with 14 years of experience. They say that they are very proud of keeping society tidy and at the same time making a profit out of it. 

They are one of Credit Mongol's reliable customers. The latest loan they have taken out has been used to buy a plot of land. And now Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is planning to build a house on their land. She has the project ready to go. The plan is to have the basement and basic structure of the house done before December, 2010, and the rest of the job will be completed during spring, 2011. The reason she is requesting this loan is she wants to buy all the necessary materials for the house and complete the basement and basic structure of the house before the winter.

loans.use: To buy all the necessary materials for a house and complete the basement and basic structure of the house before the winter

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Guadalupe P. Rodríguez desea terminar la barda de su casa para brindar a su familia mayor seguridad al momento de irse el a trabajar. Su esposa lo apoya económicamente para poder cubrir los gastos familiares, parte el trabaja como guardia en un corporativo desde hace tres años. Para realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Guadalupe P. Rodríguez would like to finish the wall around his house to provide his family with a more secure environment when he goes to work. His wife supports him financially to cover household expenses. He works part-time as a security guard for a private company, and has been doing it for three years. To carry out the project he needs to pay for the building material and labour costs.

loans.use: Erect a wall.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is a widow who lives in Bangga villa, Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  carpentry, buying and selling charcoal and selling chicken. She has three children who are 2 to 7 years old. Maricel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maricel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more materials for her carpentry business so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Maricel C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemí is a member of "The Active Women II" of the Communal Bank, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. 

Her first loan with the Communal Bank was for the amount of 500 PEN, to increase her working capital.  She sells groceries.  Noemí is 28 years old, single, and has no children. She has a higher education degree. 

She is now asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN, to buy flour, sugar, rice, and noodles for her business.  Her dreams are to have more capital for her business, have a pharmacy and to build a house. 
	
Noemí's favorite things about working with the Communal Bank are its repayment terms and the savings.

loans.use: The purchase of flour, rice, and noodles for her business selling groceries

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natalia; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, ella es soltera, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella invertirá su crédito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y comprara arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, harinas y todo al por mayor; La socia desea el crédito para cubrir sus necesidades económicas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Hijos de Qolquewasi" ["The Children of Qolquewasi"] communal bank.  Her communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Natalia.  She is 38 years old, single, and has a small grocery store.  She will invest her loan in the wholesale purchase of staple products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.  She would like this loan in order to cover her economic needs.

Ms. Natalia is grateful for and values the loan being offered to her here.  She also promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy staple goods like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo, de 37 años, está casado con Yeny, de 29 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jesús, de 8 y una bella mujercita que dentro de muy poco nacerá. En unión familiar ambos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Rodrigo es la agricultura, ya tiene 6 años en el oficio, sus principales cultivos son de café, maíz y yuca. Los que después de buen cuidado, los comercializa en la cooperativa que formaron en su comunidad, donde acopian el café para exportarlo en diferentes lugares del mundo, ya comenzaron a exportar al país de Francia, y espera que dentro de muy poco se expanda en el resto de los países. Pero los productos de pan llevar, como el caso de maíz y yuca, los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, donde viaja cada 15 días. Por ello más adelante, desea seguir comprando más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar más café. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como buen agricultor está orgulloso de salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal, con los que comparte nuevas ideas para el cuidado de sus cultivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 18 sacos de abono, en sus tres variedades.
texts.en: Rodrigo, 37, is marries to Yeny, 29.  They have 2 children: Jesus, 8, and a beautiful baby daughter, only recently born.  They live in a house they own in the town of Sanchirio (in a forested region of central Peru).  Rodrigo has operated a farming business for 6 years.  He grows coffee, maize and yucca.  After much work, he sells his coffee crop to a local cooperative that stores the coffee and exports it all over the world.  They just started exporting coffee to France and they hope to expand their sales to other countries in the near future.  He takes his other crops--maize and yucca--to the market in the city of La Merced, a trip he makes every 15 days.  In the future, Rodrigo would like to buy more land to grow more coffee.  This is his third MFP loan and he is proud that past loans have helped him to improve his business and the quality of life of his family.  He has also been able to pick up new ideas about to better tend his crops.  He will use the loan to buy 18 sacks of manure of different kinds.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: Olga Maria tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de comida a pesar de las diferentes dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar como es con la enfermedad de su hijo que es asmático.  Ella atiende este negocio todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche ya que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar sus deliciosos platillos. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como granos básicos, verduras y frutas. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Olga Maria is 28 years old.  She has a business selling meals in spite of the problems that she has had to face such as the illness of her son who is an asthmatic.  Olga Maria serves in her business every day from 7.00am to 10.00pm since most of her customers come to seek out her delicious dishes.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy products such as basic grains, fruit and vegetables.  She dreams of finishing building her house.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Rita de 43 años, es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia ya que no está casada. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado durante 5 años como comerciante informal de productos L’bel (compañía de cosméticos y productos de uso personal que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras con ventas por catalogo). Trabaja de lunes a viernes en la venta de los productos de uso personal y los fines de semana vende pescado para tener otro ingreso adicional.

Tiene muchas aspiración para su familia por eso quiere continuar trabajando pero uno de sus objetivos que ahora quiere es construir mejor su casa ya que viene el tiempo de lluvia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena, bloques. En el futuro quiere tener otro piso en su casa para alquilarlo y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman that has fought to improve her family's life since she is not married.

Living on the edge of the city in a zone called "Perimetral", she has worked for five years as an informal salesperson of L'bel products (a cosmetics and personal use products company that helps hard-working women with catalog sales). She works from Monday to Friday selling personal use products, and on the weekends she sells fish in order to have another additional income.

She has many aspirations for her family; that is why she wants to continue working. One of her objectives that she wants now, is to better construct her house since the rainy season is coming. It is for this reason that she wants to buy cement, sand, and blocks with the loan. In the future, she wants to have another floor on her house to rent out, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, and sand

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es:
Hildebrando es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Usualmente trabaja como albañil, pero como esta actividad no le provee de suficientes ingresos, el ha instalado un pequeño bar picantería en su vivienda. Allí no sólo ofrece bebidas sino que también vende diversos platos hechos a base de pescado. Los días que suele atender son los días domingos y lunes y gracias a su buena atención actualmente su clientela se encuentra creciendo.

Hildebrando desea adquirir más bebidas para ampliar su stock, asimismo desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando alimentos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is a 36 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the farming district of Tambogrande, a semitropical area known for producing mainly fruits such as mangos, lemons, and passion fruit. This community is part of the region of Piura and is located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Hildebrando usually works as a mason, but this job does not generate enough income. He opened a small bar inside of his home. There he not only offers drinks, but he also sells different dishes consisting of fish. He manages his bar on Sundays and Mondays. Thanks to the good service he provides, Hildebrando currently has a growing customer base.

He wants to acquire more beverages to increase his inventory as well as purchase supplies for the dishes he prepares. In order to accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase more beverages to increase his inventory and ingredients for preparing dishes to sell

loans.name: Badral

texts.en:
Badral, 52, is married and lives with her youngest son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is married and Badral lives in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her daughter's backyard. Her husband is retired and is living temporarily in Zavhan province with their oldest son where he works as a police officer.

Badral has been working as a conductor of a public microbus since 2000. She has owned the microbus since 1999 and she hires a man who drives the it. She is an easy-going and sociable person who says, "I would be able to save more money on what I spend for petrol if I can upgrade the microbus." She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to renew the engine and tires of her current microbus.

loans.use: To renew the engine and tires of her microbus

loans.name: Estrella's Group

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Minanga Sur. She is 61 years old and the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Estrella B.'s Group.

Estrella is married and has 4 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Mpewo Valley neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Madina has been in the restaurant business for five years, and she works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy plantains, chicken, sweet potatoes, maize flour and other ingredients.  The main business challenge for Madina is people in her debt who do not pay. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, chicken, and maize flour for her restuarant

loans.name: Germelyn

texts.en:
Germelyn M. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Germelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Germelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling hardware, auto supplies & electrical products in the local community. Germelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,010 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Germelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Germelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electrical & hardware products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Germelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electrical & hardware products.

loans.name: Diadina

texts.en:
Diadina C. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Diadina is widowed and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Diadina raises pigs for fattening and sale. Diadina has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Diadina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diadina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Diadina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Diadina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven S. is 49 years old and is a widow.  She works as a professional tailor, making US$3 each day in the Kampong Chhnang province. She has six children living at home. Her husband, Hang Rorn, makes approximately US$2.50 every day. Ven S. would like a loan of US$500 to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to finish constructing her house

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza R. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Flordeliza is married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools & pay for the utilities needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & pay for the utilities needed to provide service

loans.name: Sodnomdamba

texts.en:
Sodnomdamba is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in a Mongolian yurt, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia.  Her son is four years old and attends kindergarten.  Her husband is a factory worker.   Sodnomdamba manages a trading business of household goods in her town.  She started her business in 2009 with sock sales.  

Her initial working capital was 100,000 MNT, which has recently grown to 500,000 MNT.  She requests a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.  She plans to increase her sales so she can expand her business.  She is a polite woman who says, "I want to expand my business in order to feed my family."

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for sale.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: From the province of Siem Reap, Mr. Lem, aged 54, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up passengers in and around his community. Mr. Lem currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is the father of two children, both of whom are married and have been working in different trades. His wife sells different kinds of goods in front of his house. Mr. Lem would like a loan which will enable his wife to buy more items to sell. Mr. Lem is pictured in front of his wife's kiosk.

loans.use: to support his wife's business by buying more items to sell.

loans.name: Tabasineh Ii Group

texts.en:
Gbassay is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Gbassay was born in a place called Marah, in northern Sierra Leone. The 35-year-old is married to a schoolteacher and the couple has two children: one in primary school and one in secondary school. 

For 18 years now, Gbassay has been selling fish, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. This is not the first loan that Gbassay and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Gbassay will use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to expand her business. She  will buy fish, onions, margi, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy fish, onions, margi, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en: Marciano is 35 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and a father of five school-aged dependents. Marciano is the head of the family and a farmer. To make a living, he plants rice and harvests palay. He has been engaged in this activity for over eight years. He earns a total quarterly average of PHP 24,000 from farming. Marciano has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 at GDMPC to pay the labor costs to plant rice and to  purchase fertilizers. Marciano has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marciano hopes to buy more hectares of rice fields and harvest cavan's (50-kilo sacks) of palay.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs to plant rice and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Huayna Capac, vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gastronomía es muy variada y existen varios platos típicos, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. 

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido un hijo de 22 años que trabaja y ayuda a la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora como vendedor ambulante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Rosa desde una muy corta edad trabaja como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. En unos terrenos que tiene se dedica a la cría de  pollos, chanchos y cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, chanchos, cuyes y en su alimento. 

Su meta es  tener algún tipo de negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Capac”. She lives in El Centro in the city of Ciudad, which is known for its architecture, natural beauty, the varied cuisines, and traditional dishes. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 41 years old, married, and has a 22-year-old son who works and helps with the household finances. Her husband works as a traveling vendor. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Sra. Rosa has worked as a domestic employee for only a very short time. She works Monday through Friday from 8am to 3pm. Rosa has some land on which she raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

She is receiving her second loan from the Communal Bank and will invest the funds in the purchase of chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to have some type of business, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Joannes

texts.en:
Joannes is a farmer and a tailor in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with two children aged five and one and has been in farming for the last four years.

Joannes has requested a loan of 47,100 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him improve his family's living standards and educate the children. He plans to buy two more acres of land to expand his farming business.

Joannes says dry spells and pests are the common threats to farming output.  He is happy with Juhudi loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 45 years old, married and lives with her family in the village of Ilagan. For the last eight years, she has made a living by running a shop where she makes and sells doors, windows and kitchens. She has lots of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in her area. Carolina is applying for a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy an aluminum-cutting machine and make new items to sell. Her goal is to increase her profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for a metal shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computers, furniture, and toys for the center.

loans.name: 03.11.79 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tám has a retail business selling stationery items. She is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies for children. Tám is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 03.11.79 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tám joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tám has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tám  has been involved in her business for four years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tám hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She wants her family to be healthy and happy, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for resale

loans.name: Robinson Antonio

texts.es:
Robinson, tiene un taller de mecánica el cual repara automóviles, él lo tiene desde hace dos años y lo aprendió cursando estudios en mecanica, todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo como: un compresor y dos cajas de herramientas y repuestos para vehículos en general, de esa forma podrá atender mejor a los clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos.
El objetivo de Robinson es tener lo necesario para su trabajo, y mejor credibilidad en su negocio, y que su familia viva mejor económicamente.
texts.en:
Robinson has a mechanic's workshop where he repairs automobiles.  He has had it for the last two years, and learned this trade by taking courses in mechanics.  He works every day from Monday through Sunday.

He needs the loan to buy tools for his work, such as a compressor and two crates of tools and spare parts for vehicles in general.  In this way he will be able to serve his customers better and will be able to increase his income.

Robinson's goal is to have what he needs to do his work and better credibility for his business, and that his family can live better financially.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and crates of automotive tools.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 24 years of age and is newly married. He is in the hog raising business, primarily raising pigs for breeding. He has been in this business for almost two years and earns an average income of P5,000 monthly. Jerry’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing his business.

Jerry dreams of maintaining and developing his business to earn higher income. He plans to improve his strategies in managing his business. He is asking for a loan of P30,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs. Jerry believes that this loan will help him to attain his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya, who is 36 years-old, has made her living for the last five years selling clothing. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She has regular customers and earns a minimum of 10-15 AZN in sales every day. This is her first loan and it is in the amount of 900 AZN. The loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, sandals, bags, garments and other items to sell.  She thanks you for this loan and trusts that it will be a great help in moving forward.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Eramo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eramo tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Selva de 39 años de edad,  ellos llevan 20 años de casados y tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos.
El Sr. Eramo se dedica a la compra – venta de chatarras, baterías viejas que posteriormente los vuelve a vender a recicladoras de la zona. Don Eramo cuenta que su hijo mayor que lo ayuda con su trabajo día a día y tiene como anhelo la de formar para su propia recicladora ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro y va a poder desenvolverse sin ningún problema en esa actividad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de chatarras y baterías viejas ya que cuenta con una venta segura con las recicladoras y desea aumentar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Eramo, 39, is married to Selva, 39.  They have been married for 20 years and have the good fortune of having three children.

Eramo buys and sells scrap and old batteries that later he resells to recycling plants in the area.  Eramo's oldest son helps him with his work every day.  His desire is to start his own recycling company, since he has experience in this area and will be able to perform the job without any problem.

He is requesting the loan to buy scrap and old batteries, since he has certain sales with the recycling businesses and he wants to increase his stock of products.

loans.use: to buy scrap and old batteries to sell

loans.name: Pureza

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mae de 2 filhos  um bebe e o outro frenquenta a Escola. Fez o nivel médio e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 3 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e consegue um rendimento de cerca 7.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.600.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim,feijão, arroz, caldos, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children - one of them is a baby and the other one attends school. She finished high school and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over three years. She sells essential goods and earns an income of about 7.500mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.600mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (peanuts, beans, rice, broths, soft drinks, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
She promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future she plans to expand her retail business in order to increase her income. For that purpose she intends to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, beans, rice, broths, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica solicita un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta, ya que tiene cuatro hijos y necesitan su espacio en la casa. 
Necesita comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y arena. Y empezar la construcción. 
Doña Mónica es originaria de Veracruz y trabaja en una fabrica desde hace dos años y su esposo se encuentra trabajando como soldador en la ciudad de Monterrey, quien le esta ayudando con los gastos de sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos cuentan con tres meses de nacidos y son gemelos, por lo cual se preocupa en buscar mayor comodidad y espacio en la casa para ellos ya que solo cuenta con dos cuartos.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica is applying for a loan in order to begin construction of a room since she has four children and needs space in the house. She needs to purchase construction material such as cement blocks, rebar, and sand in order to begin building.

Doña Mónica is a native of Veracruz and has worked in a factory for two years. Her husband, whom she is helping with the expenses for their four children, works installing floors in the city of Monterrey. Two of their children are three month old twins. That’s why she is worried about seeking more comfort and space in her house, for she only has two rooms.

loans.use: to begin construction of a room.

loans.name: Liber Ramon

texts.es:
Liber de 49 años, empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad desde los 13 años y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien hasta el día de hoy.

Con ayuda de sus compañeros ya que le hace falta herramientas de trabajo. Sus dificultades son la falta de herramienta para realizar su trabajo.Si está casado y su mujer realiza los quehaceres del hogar y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que están casados.

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo madera para hacer mas acabados para la venta. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y poder tener su negocio bien adecuado.
texts.en:
Liber is 49 years old and began working at a young age, 13, and thanks to God things have gone well for him to date.  He needs some tools to do his work, but has gotten help from his friends.  He’s married and his wife takes care of the housework.  Their three children are adults and married.

He wants to continue with his business and will use the money from this loan to buy lumber to make more furniture items to sell.  His goals are to improve his home and have a well-equipped business.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has sold charcoal in the south of Sudan for the past four years.

Adut has requested this loan of 800 SDG through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to work toward building a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 27-year-old a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school.

She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC Suth Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Edwin Jonathan

texts.es:
Edwin Jonathan tiene 20 años es soltero, vive con los padres, no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Edwin Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 8 años,  las compras la realiza en Ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia.

Sueño es comprar un terreno y una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jonathan is 20 years old.  He is single, lives with his parents and does not have children.  He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Campo Alegre precinct. 
The SAN HYACINTH branch is located in the Campo Alegre precinct, near the Guare parish which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural works of short growing cycle, such as sowing corn and rice.  
Edwin Jonathan is dedicated to agriculture.  He has sown corn and rice for 8 years.  He purchases his supplies in Ventanas and sells his harvest in the same city.
He requests the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and supplements to care for his crops, as well as help him grow the family income. 
His dream is to buy land and a house.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and supplements for the care of his crops

loans.name: Tanamory Salikegne Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 14 Décembre 2010, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes d’une motivation exemplaire à faire face aux difficultés de leur milieu. Elles pratiquent en majorité la restauration et le petit commerce car se trouvant dans une zone frontalière fréquentés par beaucoup de voyageurs.

  Madame Awa,(assise à droite  restauratrice depuis plus d’une quinzaine d’années est veuve, âgée de 55 ans  et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Avec l’aide une bonne elle prépare des repas qu’elle vend aux différents voyageurs  en partance pour la sous région.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz à 14 500 FCFA le sac, un bidon d’huile de 20 litre et assaisonnement.

Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants inscris à l’école privée.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, founded on December 14, 2010, comprises women whose motivation to cope with social difficulties is exemplary.

Since they live in a border area visited by many travelers, most of these women are involved in the preparation of meals or in small retail business.

Awa (sitting on the right-hand side) has been preparing meals for over fifteen years.  At age 55, she is a widow and the mother of three children, one of whom is a girl.

With a maid's help, she prepares meals which she sells to travelers going to the sub-region.

With this new loan, she is planning to buy three bags of rice costing 14,500 CFA francs each, one 20-liter container of oil and some seasoning.

The profits from this activity help her to pay for her children's private school tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of rice costing 14,500 CFA francs each, one 20-liter container of oil and some seasoning.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is a 34-year-old married man with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He is a primary school teacher who loves his profession.  He was inspired to become a teacher, and help eradicate poverty, because of the high levels of illiteracy in his area.  Additionally, he hopes to continue his education until he earns a Bachelors degree, despite the challenge of low and delayed salary payment.

Job needs a loan to buy land to construct a home.

loans.use: to buy land for constructing a home.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
One year ago Patricia began her business of groceries sales with a small investment of $140 USD, she started buying sodas and a little groceries, so she was known between her neighbors. She is a dynamic and collaborating woman, she`s married and her husband is working in the bread elaboration business, they have three children of 17, 15 and 12 years old respectively, all her kids are studying and when they leave their school help her in the business.

Patricia wants to begin offering fruits and vegetables to her clients, because this kind of food have been a constant orders of her clients. For this reason, she needs a loan of $275 USD to have work capital and purchase fruits and vegetables to her business, she considers that with this loan, her sales will increase and she offers to repay this loan in a term of 6-12 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Hace un año que Patricia inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes con una pequeña inversión inicial de $140 USD, la cual destino a comprar refrescos y algo de abarrotes, fue así como se dio a conocer entre sus vecinos.

Ella es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de pan, tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años respectivamente, todos los cuales estudian y cuando salen de su escuela le ayudan en el negocio.

Patricia quiere iniciar ofreciendo frutas y verduras a sus clientes, ya que ha sido un pedido constante por parte de ellos, es por eso que necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 USD para tener capital de trabajo y poder surtir de frutas y verduras su negocio, considera que con ello se incrementarán sus ventas y podrá pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has three children two ging to school, she started her tailoring business three years ago and she was trained in a local politechnic in tailoring skills.

She has one employee and she intends to expand the business by buying two machines to enable her serve her increassing clients.

Given the loan i will nable her buy the two machines and also buy materials to be used in her business.

She intends to use the profit to re invest in the business and save for future use.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum K. is 30 years old and lives with his wife, father, and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  K. drives a motorcycle taxi and can make an average of about $10.00 per day.  His wife (pictured here) stays at home and watches their two young children.  K. hopes to use this loan to purchase a tuk-tuk (a passenger carriage attached to a motorcycle) to use as a taxi.  In the future, the couple would like to build a concrete house that is more sturdy than their current house.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk-tuk (passenger carriage attached to motorcycle) for transportation

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs Yeang N. is 21. Her husband is a carpenter who earns 2 dollars a day. They have two children who are in school.  In order to expand the carpentry business, they need more tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools to expand her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Sophary

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sophary was married in 1989 and has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. She started her business of buying and reselling silk products in 2003. In addition, she is also in the business of selling grocery items from her home.  Her husband is a teacher at High School in the village. All of their children are studying in high school and primary school. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase finished silk products for her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing finished silk products for her stock.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi A., 35, was born in Tado and lives in Akoin (Alinka). Married and mother of four children, she lives with her husband who is a surveyor. Her primary business venture is kerosene sales as well as sales of soap made from palm oil (traditional Togolese soap). Mrs. A. had to leave school during her primary school years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 800 that she plans to use to stock kerosene so as to grow her business and increase her income from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Amavi est née à Tado et réside à Akoin (Alinka). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle vie avec son mari. Son activité principale est la vente du pétrole et du savon fait à bas de l’huile de palme (savon traditionnel) elle a abandonné ses études au cours primaire. Son mari est géomètre de métier. Elle sollicite un montant de $800 pour faire le stockage de pétrole pour mieux accroître son activité et acquérir des bénéfices.

loans.use:
Kerosene sales

Stockage de petrole

loans.name: Farakhim

texts.en: Mr. Farakhim A. is a 22 year old single man, living in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He first started his grocery store two years ago and it has been growing ever since. He is now requesting a loan of $1200 so that he can expand his inventory in order to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana is a humble mother, with low economic resources which barely allowed her to complete her education. She got married at teh age of 18 years old with great hopes and dreams of starting a family. Unfortunately, she was emotionally and physically abused by her husband. He did not watch over the children who he gave life to. Finally, after many years, she was able to break free. Her children have grown up and gave her the moral support she needed. She separated from her husband and opened the store she always wanted, she offers canned goods. She runs this store from a small area in her home. She requests a loan to purchase more goods for her business. This hard-working mother requests your help and support in order to move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliana, es una humilD. madre, sus bajos recursos económicos apenas le permitieron concluir sus estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio a la edad D. 18 años con muchas ilusiones D. formar un hogar donD. reine la unión y amor familiar, desafortunadamente su esposo la maltrataba física y moralmente sin ninguna contemplación con sus dos hijos, quines desD. muy corta edad constantemente recibían agravios del hombre que les dió la vida.Después D. muchos años D. sufrimiento ahora con apoyo incondicional D. sus hijos ya mayores finalmente pudo separarse D. su esposo y abrir su tiendita D. abarrotes en su pequeño y humilD. domicilio, desD. entonces con la tranquilidad ya recuperada desea progresar y ocuparse completamente D. la atención D. su bodeguita. Es por esa razón que hace la solicitud D. un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad para comercializarlos en su pequeña bodeguita.Esta empeñosa madre requiere D. tu apoyo para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of high-quality, high needs products

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago Avedaño is a young man worthy of imitation because of his ability to perform carpentry work from a young age. His business is located on the patio of his home, which has the advantage of being located in a busy area.

The responsibility of this young man is to continue maintaining his humble home and elderly parents, which requires him to invest in the purchase of wood and tools in a better state in order to continue providing his clients with good service. For this reason he has requested credits from Ceprodel which would allow him to buy tools and wood of excellent quality. His record is 12 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago A. es un joven digno de imitar debido a que desde muy pequeño ha tenido la habilidad de trabajar en la carpintería. El negocio lo ubica en el patio de su casa teniendo la ventaja de estar ubicado en un lugar muy transitado.

La necesidad que atraviesa este joven es que para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar y a sus ancianos padres requiere invertir en la compra de la madera y de herramientas en mejor estado para continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por tal motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de las herramientas y madera de excelente calidad. Su record crediticio es de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sajida S. from Lahore, a historical city in Pakistan. I am 25 and a beautician and run a small salon. I want to construct and decorate another room in my salon for bridal make-up. Due to the addition of an extra room I have will have more business and therefore increased profits. 
I have few other friends who are in need of loans: Imrana A. needs this loan for her husband who is a tailor and needs to  buy a sewing machine. Nasreen Z. Ahmed wants this loan to improve her family’s shoe manufacturing. Parween R. creates garments and needs to buy cloth in bulk. Shazia S. S.’s husband is a jeweler. This is a group loan and we all are mutually responsible for the repayment of this loan.

loans.use: Construct an additional room in the salon

loans.name: Elsy Erika's Group

texts.es:
Elsy, Mariela and Raquel have belonged to the Solidaridad Banco Comunal for 5, 4, and 2 years respectively.

Elsy lives with her partner, is 23 years old and has 1 son. She sells clothing to children, distributing her products to schools. Elsy's goal is to sell natural medicine through catalogs.

Mariela lives with her partner, is 21 years old and has 1 daughter. She buys livestock in various villages and then sells it at the Sunday animal fair in Ayacucho. Somtimes Mariela slaughters the animals and sells them in the April 12th market.

Raquel lives with her partner, is 23 years old and has 2 children. Along with her husband Raquel sells groceries wholesale, which she distributes to the various stories in the city of Ayacucho.

Elsy, Mariela and Raquel need loans of 600, 400 and 1400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of underwear, natural medicine, sheep, pigs, rice and oil.

Elsy, Mariela and Raquel's dreams are to provide their children with the best possible lives, increase their capital, have a grocery store and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elsy, Mariela y Raquel pertenecen al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 5, 4, 2 años respectivamente.

Elsy es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Elsy vende ropa de niños, sus productos lo reparte a escuelas. Elsy tiene proyectado vender medicina natural por catálogos.

Por otro lado Mariela es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija, Mariela compra ganado en los diferentes pueblos y lo vende en la feria dominical de animales de Ayacucho. Algunas veces Mariela beneficia los animales y lo vende en el mercado 12 de abril.

Mientras que Raquel es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Raquel junto a su esposo venden abarrotes por mayor, que reparten a diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Elsy, Mariela y Raquel necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior, medicina natural, oveja, cerdo, arroz y aceite.

Los sueños de Elsy, Mariela y Raquel son brindar lo mejor a sus hijos, incrementar su capital, tener una tienda de abarrotes y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Elsy, Mariela y Raquel need loans of 600, 400 and 1400 soles. This moeny will be invested in the purchase of  underwear, natural medicine, sheep, pigs, rice and oil.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tháp is 58 years old. She lives in Hiệp Cường, Kim Động with her 2 children. Her husband passed away 10 years ago. Raising her children alone was hard. She holds a general store selling toothpaste, stationary ... among other things. Her revenue is 200 USD a month. For the last 7 years she has been a model entrepreneur who has obtained the most ROI among TYM members. Her children are now getting higher education so the expenses are considerable. Mrs Tháp wishes to increase her sales/income to be able to provide for her children. This time she is seeking 1200 USD to replenish her store and if possible, she would add snacks/candies/cookies to her store inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tháp năm nay 58 tuổi, chị sống cùng 2 con tại xã Hiệp Cường, Kim Động. Chồng chị mất cách đây 10 năm, một mình chị lam lũ nuôi các con ăn học. Chị Tháp có một cửa hàng tạp hóa với các mặt hàng kinh doanh chính là kem đánh răng và đồ dùng học sinh. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng là 200USD. Trong 7 năm tham gia chị luôn là thành viên sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Các con chị Tháp hiện đang theo học các trường trung cấp, cao đẳng nên chi phí đòi hỏi tương đối lớn. Chị Tháp rất muốn nâng mức thu nhập hàng tháng của mình lên cao hơn để có tiền cho con ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm hàng bán, nếu có thể thì chị sẽ kinh doanh thêm bánh kẹo, hoa quả.

loans.use: general goods for her store

loans.name: Judith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Judith del Carmen has been a merchant for 8 years. Having invested her own effort and capital, she started out selling clothing 8 years ago and after a time broke into electric appliance sales. Judith is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has two children: a 14-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl. She currently keeps her merchandise in her home, although she sometimes makes sales calls. She will use the loan to buy clothing, shoes and electric appliances to increase her sales and thereby establish a shop in her home. Judith’s dream is to be able to finish building her house and thereby give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Judith del Carmen tiene 8 años de ser una comerciante. Empezó vendiendo ropa hace 8 años, actividad que inició con esfuerzo y capital propio, con el tiempo logró también incursionar en la venta de electrodomésticos. Judith tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino. Tiene 2 hijos, un varon de 14 años de edad y una niña de 7 años de edad. Actualmente la mercadería la tiene en su casa de habitación, aunque otras veces las ventas las hace ambulante. El préstamo lo usará para comprar ropa, zapatos y electrodomésticos para reforzar sus ventas y así llegar a poner una tienda en su casa de habitación. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación, y así darles mejor vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances, clothing, shoes to increase sales

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H. is 36 years old. She has three children, all of them are at school age. Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), she didn't have much funds to do business. Thus, she was just a small retailer in her village's market. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow money and expand her business. Everyday, her husband buyes vegetable and other kinds of food, so that Mrs. H. can sell them to the villagers. Her customers include not just villagers but also other workers from the industrial area of Noibai, who have come and rent houses around this area. In 2004, Mrs. H. saw a new demand. She opened a breakfast restaurant, while still selling fruit. Her business has grown since. She is now able to buy other furniture in the house and provide her children with a good education. This time Mrs. H. would like to borrow 19,000,000 VND (approximately 1150 USD) to buy more fruit and food, in order to provide better service to her customers. On average, her family income is 6,000,000 VND (i.e., 375 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hưng năm nay 36 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vì chưa có nhiều vốn nên chị chỉ buôn bán lặt vặt nhỏ lẻ tại chợ thôn. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào kinh doanh tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi mua rau và các loại thực phẩm khác từ đại lý về để chị bán lẻ cho người dân tại địa phương. Ngoài những người dân địa phương chị còn có thêm nguồn khách hàng rất lớn là những người công nhân của khu công nghiệp Nội Bài đến thuê nhà trọ tại khu vực gia đình chị sinh sống. Năm 2004, do nắm bắt được nhu cầu của người dân địa phương gia đình chị chuyển sang bán hàng ăn sáng và buôn bán hoa quả, thu nhập ngày càng khá hơn nên chị đã có điều kiện mua sắm thêm trang thiết bị trong gia đình và đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn mua thực phẩm và hoa quả để phục vụ tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng của gia đình chị là 6.000.000 đồng

loans.use: Buy food and fruits

loans.name: Thi Sen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chị Đặng thị Sen is 30 years old. Her family cooks vegetarian food. Her group already had one 6-month lending cycle, which has already been paid back very well. This time, she wants to borrow 2.478.000 VND to buy statues for sell.

In her group, there are also:

  • Mrs. Nguyễn thị Hồng, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to cook vegetarian food.
  • Mrs. Đặng thị Thúy, borrowing 2.006.000 VND to buy cast iron to make pots
  • Mrs. Mẫn thị Lượng, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to buy cooking supplies for Vietnamese desserts
  • Mrs. Nguyễn thị Tất, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to cook vegetarian food

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

    Chị Đặng thị Sen năm nay 30 tuổi.Gia đình chị làm đồ chay.Chị cùng nhóm đã được một chu kỳ vay 6 thang và đã hoàn trả vốn vay rất tốt . Đợt này chị vay 2.478.000 VND về mua đồ tượng để làm hàng.

    Trong nhóm chị có:

  • Chị Nguyễn thị Hồng vay 2.478.000 VND để làm đồ chay.
  • Chị Đặng thị Thúy vay ở mức 2.006.000 VND để mua gang về đúc nồi
  • Chị Mẫn thị Lượng vay 2.478.000 VND mua đồ nấu chè
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Tất vay mức 2.478.000 VND để làm đồ chay

loans.use: Cooking and pot casting

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiev S. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Toy, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. These family members have only two business activities which can make only a small income and cannot improve their lives.

In order to improve Mrs. Khiev S.'s family's living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Khiev S. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business

loans.name: Kazija

texts.en:
Kazija is 45 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She has been a firewood and small fish seller since 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Kazija has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kazija is now looking for a loan to buy firewood and small fish for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and small fish for re-sale

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mr. Khem K. is 56 years old and rents musical instruments for ceremonies such as wedding parties and other happy occasions. He has been running his business since 1999 and earns currently around $4 per day. His wife, Mrs. Khlor Phalla, 47, is a grocery seller and sells many kinds of products such as oils, cake, soap, and porridge, and so forth. They have five children, two of whom are married and the other three are single and live at home. The family lives in Prey Kuy Commune, Kampong Thom Province. To support his business, Khem is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase more modern musical instruments for his business and to buy more groceries for his wife to sell. Mr. Khem's wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments and groceries

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua  que se llama 380, tiene 53 años de edad,  su esposa tiene  dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposa vende verdura ambulante para ayudar a los gastos de su familia, don Eduardo trabaja como bombero desde hade seis años, lo cual inicio como conductor en los bomberos con esta solicitud es la séptima lo cual quiere comprar materiales para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para tener mas seguridad para su familia. A largo plazo es seguir prestando en Afodenic para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa, a si como seguir prestando el servicio a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo V. lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called 380. He is 53 years old. His wife has 2 children, ages 15 and 17, who are still in school. His wife sells vegetables as a street vendor in order to help with the family expenses. Mr. V. has been working as a firefighter for six years. He started out as a fire truck driver for the fire department. This is his seventh loan request, with which he would like to purchase materials to build a protective wall in front of his house in order for his family to be safer. In the long run, he wishes to keep borrowing from Afodenic for home improvement, as well as keep providing services to society.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a protective wall

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: El grupo "Amigas por Siempre" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo representados por la señora Edith Julia han demostrado responsabilidad y cumplimiento en su anterior ciclo teniendo experiencia en grupos solidarios. En general los socios (as) se dedican a la venta de electrodomésticos, ropa, zapatillas deportivas, mochilas, comestibles, peluches y los varones a la prestación de servicios y al transporte público. Los socios (as) saben que el mercado es amplio y que la competencia es grande pero los años de experiencia les han demostrado que cuando se tiene dedicación y constancia al negocio siempre se sale adelante. El destino del financiamiento otorgado por la fundación Agrocapital es para la compra de productos e insumos para estocar sus comercios con material de buena calidad y para la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Amigas por Siempre (Friends Forever) is in their second loan cycle and are represented by Mrs. Edith Julia; they have demonstrated responsibility and accomplishment in their previous cycle as they have had experience with support groups before. In general, the members work selling appliances, clothing, athletic shoes, backpacks, food, and toys and the men work in service or public transport businesses. The group members know that the market is large and there is a lot of competition, but years of experience have taught them that dedication and consistency help businesses to continue to grow. The loan from the Agrocapital Foundation will help them purchase products and ingredients to stock their businesses with high quality materials and to repair their tools.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of four members, and they are asking for a loan from Kiva.  Mrs. S., 46, sells noodle soup and porridge in the her local market in Battambang Province.  She has been selling since 2005 and can earn around $4 per day.  She is married to Von, 48; he is a doctor for the army.  Her business is going well because it is located near a crowded market.  She cares for four children, all of whom are young.  In addition to her soup and porridge business, S. buys watermelon fruit stocks from growers and wholesales to her customers for profit.  Now is the time for this business, but she lacks capital to do it.  Therefore, she needs a loan to carry out her business activities.  

The other three members will use the loan in specific ways.  Mrs. Y. N. is widowed and sells soy-bean juice.  She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients to make soy-bean juices.  Mrs. S., 28, is food seller and needs a loan to purchase ingredients to make food.  Mrs. R., 60, is grocery seller and needs a loan to buy more groceries.

loans.use: Buy watermelon fruit stocks

loans.name: Diego Fidel

texts.es: Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù con 24 años de edad, es casado, de oficios Albañil habita junto a su hijos, y su esposa en el Caserío Paximabaj de la Aldea Nimasac, departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente Presta sus servicios de albañil en las comunidades de Totonicapán, pero debido a que  el salario es mínimo y no cubre sus necesidades básicas acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de empezar su negocio propio y con ello mejorar sus condiciones de vida y  la de su familia y así poder salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù is 24, married and works as a mason. He lives with his wife and children in Caserio Paximabaj at Aldea Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala. He currently works in the villages of Totonicapán but the wage is minimal and does not cover his basic needs. As a result, he contacted Asociación ASDIR so as to get a loan to start his own business, improve his family living and have a better future.
